analyzed: mahā udaka vāhake kho pana bhikkhave sañjāte tena gāmā api vuyhanti nigamā api vuyhanti nagarā api vuyhanti
translated: And when a great flood occurs, villages, towns, and cities are inundated.

original: Gāmesupi vuyhamānesu nigamesupi vuyhamānesu nagaresupi vuyhamānesu hoti so samayo yaṁ kadāci karahaci mātāpi puttaṁ paṭilabhati, puttopi mātaraṁ paṭilabhati.
analyzed: gāmesu pi vuyhamānesu nigamesu pi vuyhamānesu nagaresu pi vuyhamānesu hoti saḥ samayaḥ yam kadāci karahaci mātā api puttam paṭilabhati puttaḥ api mātaram paṭilabhati
translated: When villages are being plundered, when towns are being plundered, when countries are being plundered, it sometimes happens that a mother finds her child, that a child finds its mother.

original: Idaṁ, bhikkhave, dutiyaṁ samātāputtikaṁyeva bhayaṁ amātāputtikaṁ bhayanti assutavā puthujjano bhāsati.🔽Puna caparaṁ, bhikkhave, hoti so samayo yaṁ bhayaṁ hoti aṭavisaṅkopo, cakkasamāruḷhā jānapadā pariyāyanti.
analyzed: idam bhikkhave dutiyam sa mātāputtikayā iva bhayam a mātāputtikam bhayanti assutavā puthujjanaḥ bhāsati  puna capara bhikkhave hoti saḥ samayaḥ yam bhayam hoti aṭavi saṅkopaḥ cakka samāruḷhāḥ jānapadā pariyāyanti
translated: This is the second danger, separate from the first, that threatens a woman or a man who are heedless, I say, not one who is heedless.🔽“Again, there is the danger that at some time or other a time of danger arises in the world—a time of famine or a time of turbulence.

original: Bhaye kho pana, bhikkhave, sati aṭavisaṅkope cakkasamāruḷhesu jānapadesu pariyāyantesu hoti so samayo yaṁ kadāci karahaci mātāpi puttaṁ paṭilabhati, puttopi mātaraṁ paṭilabhati.
analyzed: bhaye kho pana bhikkhave sati aṭavi saṅkope cakka samāruḷhesu jānapadesu pariyāyantesu hoti saḥ samayaḥ yam kadāci karahaci mātā api puttam paṭilabhati puttaḥ api mātaram paṭilabhati
translated: When there is a time of danger in the world—a time of famine or a time of turbulence—it sometimes happens that a mother finds her child, that a child finds its mother.

original: Idaṁ, bhikkhave, tatiyaṁ samātāputtikaṁyeva bhayaṁ amātāputtikaṁ bhayanti assutavā puthujjano bhāsati.
analyzed: idam bhikkhave tatiyam sa mātāputtikayā iva bhayam a mātāputtikam bhayanti assutavā puthujjanaḥ bhāsati
translated: This is the third danger, separate from the first, that threatens a woman or a man who are heedless, I say, not one who is heedless.

original: Imāni kho, bhikkhave, tīṇi samātāputtikāniyeva bhayāni amātāputtikāni bhayānīti assutavā puthujjano bhāsati.
analyzed: imāni kho bhikkhave tīṇi sa mātāputtikāni iva bhayāni a mātāputtikāni bhayāni iti assutavā puthujjanaḥ bhāsati
translated: These are the three kinds of dangers that are not from a mother or a father, that an untaught ordinary person speaks of.

original: Tīṇimāni, bhikkhave, amātāputtikāni bhayāni.
analyzed: tīṇi imāni bhikkhave a mātāputtikāni bhayāni
translated: “Bhikkhus, there are these three kinds of dangers that are from a mother or a father.

original: Katamāni tīṇi?
analyzed: katamāni tīṇi
translated: What are the three?

original: Jarābhayaṁ, byādhibhayaṁ, maraṇabhayanti.
analyzed: jarā bhaya byādhi bhaya maraṇa bhayanti
translated: The danger of aging, the danger of sickness, and the danger of death.

original: Na, bhikkhave, mātā puttaṁ jīramānaṁ evaṁ labhati:
analyzed: na bhikkhave mātā puttam jīramānam evam labhati
translated: “When a mother is aging, bhikkhus, a son does not get her out of compassion, thinking:

original: ‘ahaṁ jīrāmi, mā me putto jīrī’ti;
analyzed: aham jīrāmi mā me puttaḥ jīri iti
translated: ‘I am aging; may I not age.’

original: putto vā pana mātaraṁ jīramānaṁ na evaṁ labhati:
analyzed: puttaḥ vā pana mātaram jīramānam na evam labhati
translated: Or when a mother is aging, a son does not get her out of fear, thinking:

original: ‘ahaṁ jīrāmi, mā me mātā jīrī’ti.
analyzed: aham jīrāmi mā me mātā jīri iti
translated: ‘I am aging; may I not age.’

original: Na, bhikkhave, mātā puttaṁ byādhiyamānaṁ evaṁ labhati:
analyzed: na bhikkhave mātā puttam byādhiyamānam evam labhati
translated: “When a mother is sick, bhikkhus, a son does not get her out of compassion, thinking:

original: ‘ahaṁ byādhiyāmi, mā me putto byādhiyī’ti;
analyzed: aham byādhiyāmi mā me puttaḥ byādhiyi iti
translated: ‘I am sick; may I not be sick.’

original: putto vā pana mātaraṁ byādhiyamānaṁ na evaṁ labhati:
analyzed: puttaḥ vā pana mātaram byādhiyamānam na evam labhati
translated: Or when a mother is sick, a son does not get her out of fear, thinking:

original: ‘ahaṁ byādhiyāmi, mā me mātā byādhiyī’ti.
analyzed: aham byādhiyāmi mā me mātā byādhiyī iti
translated: ‘I am sick; may I not be sick.’

original: Na, bhikkhave, mātā puttaṁ mīyamānaṁ evaṁ labhati:
analyzed: na bhikkhave mātā puttam mīyamānam evam labhati
translated: “When a mother is dying, bhikkhus, a son does not get her out of compassion, thinking:

original: ‘ahaṁ mīyāmi, mā me putto mīyī’ti;
analyzed: aham mīyāmi mā me puttaḥ mīyi iti
translated: ‘I am dying; may I not die.’

original: putto vā pana mātaraṁ mīyamānaṁ na evaṁ labhati:
analyzed: puttaḥ vā pana mātaram mīyamānam na evam labhati
translated: Or a mother doesn’t get the thought,

original: ‘ahaṁ mīyāmi, mā me mātā mīyī’ti.
analyzed: aham mīyāmi mā me mātā mīyi iti
translated: ‘I’m dying, but may my child not die.’

original: Imāni kho, bhikkhave, tīṇi amātāputtikāni bhayānīti.🔽Atthi, bhikkhave, maggo atthi paṭipadā imesañca tiṇṇaṁ samātāputtikānaṁ bhayānaṁ imesañca tiṇṇaṁ amātāputtikānaṁ bhayānaṁ pahānāya samatikkamāya saṁvattati.
analyzed: imāni kho bhikkhave tīṇi a mātāputtikāni bhayāni iti  atthi bhikkhave maggaḥ atthi paṭipadā imesaṃ ca tiṇṇam sa mātāputtikānam bhayānam imesaṃ ca tiṇṇam a mātāputtikānam bhayānam pahānāya samatikkamāya savattati
translated: These are the three dangers that are not from a mother or father.🔽“There is a path, monks, there is a practice for the abandoning and overcoming of these three dangers from a mother or father and these three dangers not from a mother or father.

original: Katamo ca, bhikkhave, maggo katamā ca paṭipadā imesañca tiṇṇaṁ samātāputtikānaṁ bhayānaṁ imesañca tiṇṇaṁ amātāputtikānaṁ bhayānaṁ pahānāya samatikkamāya saṁvattati?
analyzed: katamaḥ ca bhikkhave maggaḥ katamā ca paṭipadā imesaṃ ca tiṇṇam sa mātāputtikānam bhayānam imesaṃ ca tiṇṇam a mātāputtikānam bhayānam pahānāya samatikkamāya savattati
translated: And what is that path, what is that practice?

original: Ayameva ariyo aṭṭhaṅgiko maggo, seyyathidaṁ—
analyzed: ayam eva ariyaḥ aṭṭhaṅgikaḥ maggo
translated: It is simply this noble eightfold path, that is:

original: sammādiṭṭhi, sammāsaṅkappo, sammāvācā, sammākammanto, sammāājīvo, sammāvāyāmo, sammāsati, sammāsamādhi.
analyzed: sammā diṭṭhi sammā saṅkappo sammā vācā sammā kammanto sammā ājīvaḥ sammā vāyāmaḥ sammā sati sammā samādhi
translated: right view, right resolve, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, and right concentration.

original: Ayaṁ kho, bhikkhave, maggo ayaṁ paṭipadā imesañca tiṇṇaṁ samātāputtikānaṁ bhayānaṁ imesañca tiṇṇaṁ amātāputtikānaṁ bhayānaṁ pahānāya samatikkamāya saṁvattatī”ti.🔽Dutiyaṁ.
analyzed: ayam kho bhikkhave maggaḥ ayam paṭipadā imesaṃ ca tiṇṇam sa mātāputtikānam bhayānam imesaṃ ca tiṇṇam a mātāputtikānam bhayānam pahānāya samatikkamāya savattati iti  dutiya
translated: This is the path, bhikkhus, this is the way for the relinquishment of these three kinds of fear that are born of attachment and for the relinquishment of these three kinds of fear that are not born of attachment.”

original: Aṅguttara Nikāya 3.63
analyzed: aṅguttara nikāya
translated: The second section on the three is finished.🔽The Book of the Elevens

original: 7. Mahāvagga
analyzed: mahāvagga
translated: The Greater Section

original: Venāgapurasutta
analyzed: venāgapura sutta
translated: At Venāgapura

original: Ekaṁ samayaṁ bhagavā kosalesu cārikaṁ caramāno mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṁ yena venāgapuraṁ nāma kosalānaṁ brāhmaṇagāmo tadavasari.
analyzed: ekam samayam bhagavā kosalesu cārikam caramānaḥ mahatā bhikkhu saṅghena saddhim yena venāgapuram nāma kosalānam brāhmaṇa gāmaḥ tat avasari
translated: On one occasion the Blessed One was wandering in the Kosalan country with a large Saṅgha of bhikkhus when he arrived at a Kosalan village named Venāgapura.

original: Assosuṁ kho venāgapurikā brāhmaṇagahapatikā:
analyzed: venāgapurikā brāhmaṇa gahapatikā
translated: The brahmin householders of Venāgapura heard:

original: “samaṇo khalu, bho, gotamo sakyaputto sakyakulā pabbajito venāgapuraṁ anuppatto.
analyzed: samaṇaḥ khalu bho gotamaḥ sakya putto sakya kulā pabbajitaḥ venāgapuram anuppatto
translated: “The recluse Gotama, the son of the Sakyans who went forth from a Sakyan clan, has been wandering in the Kosalan country with a large Saṅgha of bhikkhus and has come to Venāgapura.

original: Taṁ kho pana bhavantaṁ gotamaṁ evaṁ kalyāṇo kittisaddo abbhuggato:
analyzed: tam kha pana bhavantam gotamam evam kalyāṇaḥ kitti saddaḥ abbhuggataḥ
translated: Now a good report of Master Gotama has been spread to this effect:

original: ‘itipi so bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho vijjācaraṇasampanno sugato lokavidū anuttaro purisadammasārathi satthā devamanussānaṁ buddho bhagavā’ti.
analyzed: iti pi saḥ bhagavā araham sammāsambuddhaḥ vijjā caraṇa sampanno sugataḥ loka vidū anuttaraḥ purisa damma sārathi satthā deva manussānam buddhaḥ bhagavā ati
translated: ‘That Blessed One is accomplished, fully enlightened, perfect in true knowledge and conduct, sublime, knower of worlds, incomparable leader of persons to be tamed, teacher of gods and humans, enlightened, blessed.’

original: So imaṁ lokaṁ sadevakaṁ samārakaṁ sabrahmakaṁ sassamaṇabrāhmaṇiṁ pajaṁ sadevamanussaṁ sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā pavedeti.
analyzed: saḥ imam lokam sa devakam sa mārakam sa brahmakam sa ssamaṇa brāhmaṇim pajam sa deva manussam sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā pavedeti
translated: He has realized this world—with its gods, Māras and Brahmās, this population with its ascetics and brahmins, gods and humans—and he makes it known to others.

original: So dhammaṁ deseti ādikalyāṇaṁ majjhekalyāṇaṁ pariyosānakalyāṇaṁ sātthaṁ sabyañjanaṁ, kevalaparipuṇṇaṁ parisuddhaṁ brahmacariyaṁ pakāseti.
analyzed: saḥ dhammam deseti ādi kalyāṇam majjhe kalyāṇam pariyosāna kalyāṇam sa attham sa byañjana kevala paripuṇṇam parisuddham brahmacariyam pakāseti
translated: He teaches Dhamma that’s good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end, with the right meaning and phrasing; he reveals a holy life that’s utterly perfect and pure.

original: Sādhu kho pana tathārūpānaṁ arahataṁ dassanaṁ hotī”ti.
analyzed: sādhu kho pana tathārūpānam arahatam dassanam hoti iti
translated: It’s good to see such perfected ones.”

original: Atha kho venāgapurikā brāhmaṇagahapatikā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkamiṁsu; upasaṅkamitvā
analyzed: atha khalu venāgapurikāḥ brāhmaṇa gahapatikāḥ yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkamiṣu upasaṅkamitvā
translated: Then the brahmin householders of Venāgapura went to the Buddha.🔽Some bowed and sat down to one side,

original: appekacce bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdiṁsu, appekacce bhagavatā saddhiṁ🔽sammodiṁsu, sammodanīyaṁ kathaṁ sāraṇīyaṁ vītisāretvā ekamantaṁ nisīdiṁsu, appekacce
analyzed: appekacce bhagavantam abhivādetvā ekamantam nisīdisu appekacce bhagavatā saddhi  sammodisu sammodanīyam katham sāraṇīyam vītisāretvā ekamantam nisīdisu appekacce
translated: some exchanged greetings with the Buddha,🔽some raised their joined palms to the Buddha,

original: yena bhagavā tenañjaliṁ paṇāmetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdiṁsu, appekacce nāmagottaṁ sāvetvā
analyzed: yena bhagavā tena añjalim paṇāmetvā ekamantam appekacce nāma gottam sāvetvā
translated: some announced their name and clan,🔽and sat down to one side,

original: ekamantaṁ nisīdiṁsu, appekacce tuṇhībhūtā ekamantaṁ nisīdiṁsu. Ekamantaṁ nisinno
analyzed: ekamantam nisīdisu appekacce tuṇhībhūtāḥ ekamantam nisīdisu ekamantam nisinno
translated: sat down to one side, some remained standing, some exchanged greetings with the Fortunate One and, after exchanging courteous greetings, stood to one side, some respectfully saluted the Fortunate One with their hands together (in homage) and stood to one side, some announced their name and family to the Fortunate One, and sat down to one side, some, after arranging their upper robes over one shoulder, and falling with their knees to the ground and their hands together (in homage) said this to the Fortunate One:

original: kho venāgapuriko vacchagotto brāhmaṇo bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: kho venāgapurikaḥ vaccha gottaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: while sitting on one side the brāhmaṇa Vacchagotta of Vebhalinga said this to the Fortunate One:

original: “Acchariyaṁ, bho gotama, abbhutaṁ, bho gotama.
analyzed: acchariya bho gotama abbhuta bho gotama
translated: “It is wonderful, dear Gotama, it is marvellous,

original: Yāvañcidaṁ bhoto gotamassa vippasannāni indriyāni, parisuddho chavivaṇṇo pariyodāto.
analyzed: yāvañcidam bhoto gotamassa vippasannāni indriyāni parisuddhaḥ chavi vaṇṇaḥ pariyodāto
translated: how clear the faculties are of the dear Gotama, how pure is the skin-tone and complexion.

original: Seyyathāpi, bho gotama, sāradaṁ badarapaṇḍuṁ parisuddhaṁ hoti pariyodātaṁ;
analyzed: seyyathā api bho gotama sāradam badara paṇḍum parisuddham hoti
translated: Just as a sārada badara fruit is clear and pure,

original: evamevaṁ bhoto gotamassa vippasannāni indriyāni parisuddho chavivaṇṇo pariyodāto.
analyzed: evam evam bhoto gotamassa vippasannāni indriyāni parisuddhaḥ chavi vaṇṇaḥ pariyodāto
translated: so too, dear Gotama, is the dear Gotama’s clear faculties, pure is the skin-tone and complexion.

original: Seyyathāpi, bho gotama, tālapakkaṁ sampati bandhanā pamuttaṁ parisuddhaṁ hoti pariyodātaṁ;
analyzed: seyyathā api bho gotama tāla pakkam sampati bandhanā pamuttam parisuddham hoti
translated: Just as a tāla fruit is clear and pure,

original: evamevaṁ bhoto gotamassa vippasannāni indriyāni parisuddho chavivaṇṇo pariyodāto.
analyzed: evam evam bhoto gotamassa vippasannāni indriyāni parisuddhaḥ chavi vaṇṇaḥ pariyodāto
translated: so too, dear Gotama, is the dear Gotama’s clear faculties, pure is the skin-tone and complexion.

original: Seyyathāpi, bho gotama, nekkhaṁ jambonadaṁ dakkhakammāraputtasuparikammakataṁ ukkāmukhe sukusalasampahaṭṭhaṁ paṇḍukambale nikkhittaṁ bhāsate ca tapate ca virocati ca;
analyzed: seyyathā api bho gotama nekkham jambonadam dakkha kammāra putta su parikamma katam ukkā mukhe su kusala sampahaṭṭham paṇḍu kambale nikkhittam bhāsate ca tapate ca virocati ca
translated: and when placed on a polished crystal slab, would shine, gleam, and radiate,

original: evamevaṁ bhoto gotamassa vippasannāni indriyāni parisuddho chavivaṇṇo pariyodāto.
analyzed: evam evam bhoto gotamassa vippasannāni indriyāni parisuddhaḥ chavi vaṇṇaḥ pariyodāto
translated: so too are your faculties clear, your complexion is pure and bright.🔽Master Gotama, there are these high and luxurious beds and seats:

original: Yāni tāni, bho gotama, uccāsayanamahāsayanāni, seyyathidaṁ—🔽āsandi pallaṅko gonako cittako paṭikā paṭalikā tūlikā vikatikā uddalomī ekantalomī
analyzed: yāni tāni bho gotama uccāsayana mahāsayanāni  āsandi pallaṅkaḥ gonako cittako paṭikā paṭalikā tūlikā vikatikā uddalomī ekantalomī
translated: namely,

original: kaṭṭissaṁ koseyyaṁ kuttakaṁ hatthattharaṁ assattharaṁ rathattharaṁ ajinappaveṇī kadalimigapavarapaccattharaṇaṁ
analyzed: kaṭṭissam koseyyam kuttakam hatthattharam assattharam rathattharam ajinappaveṇī kadali miga pavara paccattharaṇa
translated: a couch, a chair, a sofa, a rug, a cotton-down quilt, a woolen rug, a multi-colored rug, a white woolen rug, a rug of antelope hide, a silken sheet, a woolen sheet, a cotton sheet, a duvet, a deer hide, a coverlet of kadalī-deer hide, a spread of kadalī-deer hides, a spread of the kaṭṭīra-deer hide, a spread of the karavīka-deer hide, a spread of the siṅgālaka-deer hide, a spread of the siṅgālaka-deer hide with the hair on, a spread of pure white woolen cloth, a canopy, and a foot stool.

original: sauttaracchadaṁ ubhatolohitakūpadhānaṁ, evarūpānaṁ nūna bhavaṁ gotamo uccāsayanamahāsayanānaṁ
analyzed: sa auttaracchadam ubhatas lohitakūpa dhāne nūna bhavam gotamaḥ
translated: Master Gotama is surely one who obtains at will, without trouble or difficulty,

original: nikāmalābhī akicchalābhī akasiralābhī”ti.
analyzed: nikāma lābhī a kiccha lābhī a kasira lābhī iti
translated: such high and luxurious beds and seats.”🔽“There are, brahmin, these high and luxurious beds and seats:🔽namely, a couch, a chair, a sofa, a rug, a cotton-down quilt, a woolen rug, a multi-colored rug, a white woolen rug, a rug of antelope hide, a silken sheet, a woolen sheet, a cotton sheet, a duvet, a deer hide, a coverlet of kadalī-deer hide, a spread of kadalī-deer hides, a spread of the kaṭṭīra-deer hide, a spread of the karavīka-deer hide, a spread of the siṅgālaka-deer hide, a spread of the siṅgālaka-deer hide with the hair on, a spread of pure white woolen cloth, a canopy, and a foot stool.

original: “Yāni kho pana tāni, brāhmaṇa, uccāsayanamahāsayanāni, seyyathidaṁ—🔽āsandi pallaṅko gonako cittako paṭikā paṭalikā tūlikā vikatikā uddalomī ekantalomī🔽kaṭṭissaṁ koseyyaṁ kuttakaṁ hatthattharaṁ assattharaṁ rathattharaṁ ajinappaveṇī kadalimigapavarapaccattharaṇaṁ
analyzed: yāni khalu pana tāni brāhmaṇaḥ uccāsayana mahāsayanāni  āsandi pallaṅkaḥ gonako cittako paṭikā paṭalikā tūlikā vikatikā uddalomī ekantalomī  kaṭṭissam koseyyam kuttakam hatthattharam assattharam rathattharam ajinappaveṇī kadali miga pavara paccattharaṇa
translated: “Brahmin, there are these high and luxurious beds and seats:🔽high couches, luxurious couches, large couches, couches decorated with gems, upholstered couches, couches with spreads of antelope hide, with fringed covers of cotton or silk, with red cushions at both ends;🔽elephant-back, horse-back, chariot, human-back;

original: sauttaracchadaṁ ubhatolohitakūpadhānaṁ.
analyzed: sa auttaracchadam ubhatas lohita kūpa dhāna
translated: a canopy, a floor cover, a pillow, a fan.

original: Dullabhāni tāni pabbajitānaṁ laddhā ca pana na kappanti.
analyzed: dullabhāni tāni pabbajitānam laddhā ca pana na kappanti
translated: These are hard to get for those gone forth, and even if they get them, they are not allowed to use them.

original: Tīṇi kho, imāni, brāhmaṇa, uccāsayanamahāsayanāni, yesāhaṁ etarahi nikāmalābhī akicchalābhī akasiralābhī.
analyzed: tīṇi kho imāni brāhmaṇaḥ uccāsayana mahāsayanāni yesāham etarahi nikāma lābhī a kiccha lābhī a kasira lābhī
translated: But there are three high and luxurious beds and seats that I now use at will, without difficulty or trouble.

original: Katamāni tīṇi?
analyzed: katamāni tīṇi
translated: What are the three?

original: Dibbaṁ uccāsayanamahāsayanaṁ, brahmaṁ uccāsayanamahāsayanaṁ, ariyaṁ uccāsayanamahāsayanaṁ.
analyzed: dibbam uccāsayana mahāsayana brahmam uccāsayana mahāsayana ariyam uccāsayana mahāsayana
translated: The high and luxurious bed and seat of the gods, the high and luxurious bed and seat of the Brahma world, and the high and luxurious bed and seat of the noble ones.

original: Imāni kho, brāhmaṇa, tīṇi uccāsayanamahāsayanāni, yesāhaṁ etarahi nikāmalābhī akicchalābhī akasiralābhī”ti.
analyzed: imāni khalu brāhmaṇa tīṇi uccāsayana mahāsayanāni yesāham etarahi nikāma lābhī a kiccha lābhī a kasira lābhī iti
translated: These are the three high and luxurious beds and seats that I now use at will, without difficulty or trouble.”

original: “Katamaṁ pana taṁ, bho gotama, dibbaṁ uccāsayanamahāsayanaṁ, yassa bhavaṁ gotamo etarahi nikāmalābhī akicchalābhī akasiralābhī”ti?
analyzed: katamam pana bho gotama dibbam uccāsayana mahāsayana yassa bhavam gotamaḥ etarahi nikāma lābhī a kiccha lābhī a kasira lābhī iti
translated: “But what, Master Gotama, is the divine high and luxurious bed that Master Gotama now enjoys at his ease, having attained it without trouble or difficulty?”

original: “Idhāhaṁ, brāhmaṇa, yaṁ gāmaṁ vā nigamaṁ vā upanissāya viharāmi, so pubbaṇhasamayaṁ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya tameva gāmaṁ vā nigamaṁ vā piṇḍāya pavisāmi.
analyzed: idha āha brāhmaṇa yam gāmam vā nigamam vā upanissāya viharāmi so pubbaṇhasamayam nivāsetvā patta cīvaram ādāya tam eva gāmam vā nigamam vā piṇḍāya pavisāmi
translated: “Here, brahmin, I live in dependence on a certain village or town. In the morning I put on my robes and, taking my bowl and outer robe, I go into the village or town for alms.

original: So pacchābhattaṁ piṇḍapātapaṭikkanto vanantaññeva pavisāmi.🔽So yadeva tattha honti tiṇāni vā paṇṇāni vā tāni ekajjhaṁ saṅgharitvā nisīdāmi pallaṅkaṁ ābhujitvā ujuṁ kāyaṁ paṇidhāya parimukhaṁ satiṁ upaṭṭhapetvā.
analyzed: so pacchābhattam piṇḍapāta paṭikkantaḥ vanantaññā iva pavisāmi  saḥ yat eva tattha honti tiṇāni vā paṇṇāni vā tāni ekajjham saṅgharitvā nisīdāmi pallaṅkam ābhujitvā ujum kāyam paṇidhāya parimukham satim upaṭṭhapetvā
translated: After the meal, on my return from the alms round, I enter the grove.🔽There I sit down on a seat prepared for me and I meditate, having resolved with my mind.

original: So vivicceva kāmehi vivicca akusalehi dhammehi savitakkaṁ savicāraṁ vivekajaṁ pītisukhaṁ paṭhamaṁ jhānaṁ upasampajja viharāmi;
analyzed: saḥ vivicca iva kāmehi vivicca akusalehi dhammehi sa vitakkam sa vicāram viveka jam pīti sukham paṭhamam jhānam upasampajja viharāmi
translated: Quite secluded from sensual pleasures, secluded from unwholesome states, I enter upon and abide in the first jhana, which is accompanied by applied and sustained thought, with rapture and pleasure born of seclusion.

original: vitakkavicārānaṁ vūpasamā ajjhattaṁ sampasādanaṁ cetaso ekodibhāvaṁ avitakkaṁ avicāraṁ samādhijaṁ pītisukhaṁ dutiyaṁ jhānaṁ upasampajja viharāmi;🔽pītiyā ca virāgā upekkhako ca viharāmi sato ca sampajāno sukhañca kāyena paṭisaṁvedemi,
analyzed: vitakka vicārānam vūpasamāḥ ajjhattam sampasādanam cetasaḥ eka udi bhāvam a vitakkam a vicāram samādhi jam pīti sukham dutiyam jhānam upasampajja viharāmi  pītiyā ca virāgā upekkhako ca viharāmi sataḥ ca sampajāno sukham ca kāyena paṭisavedemi
translated: With the stilling of directed thoughts & evaluations, I entered & remained in the second jhāna: rapture & pleasure born of concentration, unification of awareness free from directed thought & evaluation — internal assurance.

original: yaṁ taṁ ariyā ācikkhanti: ‘upekkhako satimā sukhavihārī’ti tatiyaṁ jhānaṁ upasampajja viharāmi;
analyzed: yam tam ariyāḥ ācikkhanti upekkhakaḥ satimā sukha vihārī iti tatiyam jhānam upasampajja viharāmi
translated: With the fading of rapture, I remained equanimous, mindful, & alert, and sensed pleasure with the body. I entered & remained in the third jhāna, of which the noble ones declare, ‘Equanimous & mindful, he has a pleasant abiding.’

original: sukhassa ca pahānā dukkhassa ca pahānā pubbeva somanassadomanassānaṁ atthaṅgamā adukkhamasukhaṁ upekkhāsatipārisuddhiṁ catutthaṁ jhānaṁ upasampajja viharāmi.🔽So ce ahaṁ, brāhmaṇa, evaṁbhūto caṅkamāmi, dibbo me eso tasmiṁ samaye caṅkamo hoti.
analyzed: sukhassa ca pahānā dukkhassa ca pahānā pubbā iva somanassa domanassānam atthaṅgamā adukkham asukham upekkhā sati pārisuddhim catuttham jhānam upasampajja viharāmi  saḥ ce aha brāhmaṇaḥ eva bhūtaḥ caṅkamāmi dibbaḥ me eso tasmin samaye caṅkamaḥ hoti
translated: With the abandoning of pleasure & pain — as with the earlier disappearance of elation & distress — I entered & remained in the fourth jhāna: purity of equanimity & mindfulness, neither pleasure nor pain.🔽“If, brahmin, I walk back & forth, on that occasion my walking back & forth is divine.

original: So ce ahaṁ, brāhmaṇa, evaṁbhūto tiṭṭhāmi, dibbaṁ me etaṁ tasmiṁ samaye ṭhānaṁ hoti.
analyzed: saḥ ce aha brāhmaṇaḥ eva bhūto tiṭṭhāmi dibbam me etam tasmim samaye ṭhānam hoti
translated: If, brahmin, I stand, on that occasion my standing is divine.

original: So ce ahaṁ, brāhmaṇa, evaṁbhūto nisīdāmi, dibbaṁ me etaṁ tasmiṁ samaye āsanaṁ hoti.
analyzed: saḥ ce aha brāhmaṇaḥ eva bhūtaḥ nisīdāmi dibbam me etam tasmin samaye āsanam hoti
translated: If I sit down, it is divine sitting that I enjoy.

original: So ce ahaṁ, brāhmaṇa, evaṁbhūto seyyaṁ kappemi, dibbaṁ me etaṁ tasmiṁ samaye uccāsayanamahāsayanaṁ hoti.
analyzed: saḥ ce aha brāhmaṇaḥ evabhūtaḥ seyyam kappemi dibbam me etam tasmim samaye uccāsayana mahāsayanam hoti
translated: If I lie down, it is divine lying that I enjoy.

original: Idaṁ kho, brāhmaṇa, dibbaṁ uccāsayanamahāsayanaṁ, yassāhaṁ etarahi nikāmalābhī akicchalābhī akasiralābhī”ti.
analyzed: idam kho brāhmaṇa dibbam uccāsayana mahāsayana yassa aham etarahi nikāma lābhī a kiccha lābhī a kasira lābhī iti
translated: This is the divine high and luxurious bed that I now enjoy at will, without difficulty, without trouble.”

original: “Acchariyaṁ, bho gotama, abbhutaṁ, bho gotama.🔽Ko cañño evarūpassa dibbassa uccāsayanamahāsayanassa nikāmalābhī bhavissati akicchalābhī akasiralābhī, aññatra bhotā gotamena.
analyzed: acchariya bho gotama abbhuta bho gotama  kaḥ caññaḥ evarūpassa dibbassa uccāsayana mahāsayanassa nikāma lābhī bhavissati akiccha lābhī akasira lābhī aññatra bhotā gotamena
translated: “It is wonderful, Master Gotama, it is marvellous!🔽Who else but Master Gotama could enjoy such a divine high and luxurious bed?

original: Katamaṁ pana taṁ, bho gotama, brahmaṁ uccāsayanamahāsayanaṁ, yassa bhavaṁ gotamo etarahi nikāmalābhī akicchalābhī akasiralābhī”ti?
analyzed: katamam pana bho gotama brahman uccāsayana mahāsayana yassa bhavam gotamaḥ etarahi nikāma lābhī a kiccha lābhī a kasira lābhī iti
translated: But what, Master Gotama, is the divine high and luxurious bed that Master Gotama now enjoys at will, without difficulty, without trouble?”

original: “Idhāhaṁ, brāhmaṇa, yaṁ gāmaṁ vā nigamaṁ vā upanissāya viharāmi, so pubbaṇhasamayaṁ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya tameva gāmaṁ vā nigamaṁ vā piṇḍāya pavisāmi.
analyzed: idha āha brāhmaṇa yam gāmam vā nigamam vā upanissāya viharāmi so pubbaṇhasamayam nivāsetvā patta cīvaram ādāya tam eva gāmam vā nigamam vā piṇḍāya pavisāmi
translated: In the morning I put on my robes and, taking my bowl and outer robe, I go into the village or town for alms.

original: So pacchābhattaṁ piṇḍapātapaṭikkanto vanantaññeva pavisāmi.
analyzed: so pacchābhattam piṇḍapāta paṭikkantaḥ vanantaññā iva pavisāmi
translated: After the meal, on my return from almsround, I enter the forest.

original: So yadeva tattha honti tiṇāni vā paṇṇāni vā tāni ekajjhaṁ saṅgharitvā nisīdāmi pallaṅkaṁ ābhujitvā ujuṁ kāyaṁ paṇidhāya parimukhaṁ satiṁ upaṭṭhapetvā.🔽So mettāsahagatena cetasā ekaṁ disaṁ pharitvā viharāmi, tathā dutiyaṁ, tathā tatiyaṁ,🔽tathā catutthaṁ, iti uddhamadho tiriyaṁ sabbadhi sabbattatāya sabbāvantaṁ lokaṁ mettāsahagatena
analyzed: saḥ yat eva tattha honti tiṇāni vā paṇṇāni vā tāni ekajjham saṅgharitvā nisīdāmi pallaṅkam ābhujitvā ujum kāyam paṇidhāya parimukham satim upaṭṭhapetvā  saḥ mettā sahagatena cetasā ekam disam viharāmi tathā dutiya tathā tatiya  tathā catutthaḥ iti uddham adhas tiriyam sabbadhi sabbattatāya sabbāvantam lokam mettā sahagatena
translated: There I gather together whatever grass and leaves there are and I sit down, cross-legged, with my body erect and mindfulness established in front of me.

original: cetasā vipulena mahaggatena appamāṇena averena abyāpajjena pharitvā viharāmi.
analyzed: cetasā vipulena mahaggatena appamāṇena averena a byāpajjena pharitvā viharāmi
translated: I abide pervading one quarter with a mind imbued with loving-kindness, likewise the second, likewise the third, likewise the fourth; so above, below, around, and everywhere, and to all as to myself, I abide pervading the all-encompassing world with a mind imbued with loving-kindness, abundant, exalted, immeasurable, without hostility and without ill will.

original: Karuṇāsahagatena cetasā …pe…
analyzed: karuṇā sahagatena cetasā pe
translated: I abide pervading one quarter with a mind imbued with compassion …

original: muditāsahagatena cetasā …
analyzed: muditā sahagatena cetasā
translated: with a mind imbued with appreciative joy …

original: upekkhāsahagatena cetasā ekaṁ disaṁ pharitvā viharāmi, tathā dutiyaṁ, tathā tatiyaṁ,🔽tathā catutthaṁ, iti uddhamadho tiriyaṁ sabbadhi sabbattatāya sabbāvantaṁ lokaṁ upekkhāsahagatena
analyzed: upekkhā sahagatena cetasā ekam disam pharitvā viharāmi tathā dutiya tathā tatiya  tathā catutthaḥ iti uddham adhas tiriyam sabbadhi sabbattatāya sabbāvantam lokam upekkhā sahagatena
translated: I abide pervading one quarter with a mind imbued with equanimity, likewise the second, likewise the third, likewise the fourth;

original: cetasā vipulena mahaggatena appamāṇena averena abyāpajjhena pharitvā viharāmi.
analyzed: cetasā vipulena mahaggatena appamāṇena averena abyāpajjhena pharitvā viharāmi
translated: so above, below, across, and everywhere, and to all as to myself, I abide pervading the entire world with a mind imbued with equanimity, vast, exalted, measureless, without hostility, without ill will.

original: So ce ahaṁ, brāhmaṇa, evaṁbhūto caṅkamāmi, brahmā me eso tasmiṁ samaye caṅkamo hoti.
analyzed: saḥ ce aha brāhmaṇaḥ eva bhūtaḥ caṅkamāmi brahmā me tasmin samaye caṅkamaḥ hoti
translated: When I am walking, brahmin, that is my brahma abode.

original: So ce ahaṁ, brāhmaṇa, evaṁbhūto tiṭṭhāmi …pe…
analyzed: saḥ ce aha brāhmaṇaḥ eva bhūto tiṭṭhāmi pe
translated: When I am standing …

original: nisīdāmi …pe…
analyzed: nisīdāmi pe
translated: when I am sitting …

original: seyyaṁ kappemi, brahmaṁ me etaṁ tasmiṁ samaye uccāsayanamahāsayanaṁ hoti.
analyzed: seyyam kappemi brahmam me etam tasmin samaye uccāsayana mahāsayanam hoti
translated: when I am lying down, that is my brahma abode.

original: Idaṁ kho, brāhmaṇa, brahmaṁ uccāsayanamahāsayanaṁ, yassāhaṁ etarahi nikāmalābhī akicchalābhī akasiralābhī”ti.
analyzed: idam kho brāhmaṇa brahmam uccāsayana mahāsayana yassa aham etarahi nikāma lābhī a kiccha lābhī a kasira lābhī iti
translated: This is the brahma abode, brahmin, for the attainment of which my disciples train.”

original: “Acchariyaṁ, bho gotama, abbhutaṁ, bho gotama.
analyzed: acchariya bho gotama abbhuta bho gotama
translated: “It is wonderful, Master Gotama, it is marvellous!

original: Ko cañño evarūpassa brahmassa uccāsayanamahāsayanassa nikāmalābhī bhavissati akicchalābhī akasiralābhī, aññatra bhotā gotamena.
analyzed: kaḥ caññaḥ evarūpassa brahmassa uccāsayana mahāsayanassa nikāma lābhī bhavissati akiccha lābhī akasira lābhī aññatra bhotā gotamena
translated: Who else is there who could so easily obtain such a high and luxurious bed as this brahmin?

original: Katamaṁ pana taṁ, bho gotama, ariyaṁ uccāsayanamahāsayanaṁ, yassa bhavaṁ gotamo etarahi nikāmalābhī akicchalābhī akasiralābhī”ti?
analyzed: katamam pana bho gotama ariyam uccāsayana mahāsayana yassa bhavam gotamaḥ etarahi nikāma lābhī a kiccha lābhī a kasira lābhī iti
translated: But what, Master Gotama, is that noble high and luxurious bed that Master Gotama now so easily obtains?”

original: “Idhāhaṁ, brāhmaṇa, yaṁ gāmaṁ vā nigamaṁ vā upanissāya viharāmi, so pubbaṇhasamayaṁ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya tameva gāmaṁ vā nigamaṁ vā piṇḍāya pavisāmi.
analyzed: idha āha brāhmaṇa yam gāmam vā nigamam vā upanissāya viharāmi so pubbaṇhasamayam nivāsetvā patta cīvaram ādāya tam eva gāmam vā nigamam vā piṇḍāya pavisāmi
translated: “Brahmin, when I live in dependence on a certain village or town, then in the morning I dress, take my bowl and robe, and enter that village or town for alms.

original: So pacchābhattaṁ piṇḍapātapaṭikkanto vanantaññeva pavisāmi.
analyzed: so pacchābhattam piṇḍapāta paṭikkantaḥ vanantaññā iva pavisāmi
translated: After the alms round and the meal, returning from my alms round, I enter that same village or town and go into the woods.

original: So yadeva tattha honti tiṇāni vā paṇṇāni vā tāni ekajjhaṁ saṅgharitvā nisīdāmi pallaṅkaṁ ābhujitvā ujuṁ kāyaṁ paṇidhāya parimukhaṁ satiṁ upaṭṭhapetvā.
analyzed: saḥ yat eva tattha honti tiṇāni vā paṇṇāni vā tāni ekajjham saṅgharitvā nisīdāmi pallaṅkam ābhujitvā ujum kāyam paṇidhāya parimukham satim upaṭṭhapetvā
translated: There I gather together the grass, sticks, branches, and leaves, and having done so, I sit down cross-legged, with my body erect, and I establish mindfulness in front of me.

original: So evaṁ jānāmi:
analyzed: saḥ u evam jānāmi
translated: I understand thus:

original: ‘rāgo me pahīno ucchinnamūlo tālāvatthukato anabhāvaṅkato āyatiṁ anuppādadhammo;🔽doso me pahīno ucchinnamūlo tālāvatthukato anabhāvaṅkato āyatiṁ anuppādadhammo;
analyzed: rāgaḥ me pahīnaḥ ucchinna mūlaḥ tālā vatthu kataḥ anabhāvaṅkataḥ āyatim an uppāda dhammo  dosaḥ me pahīnaḥ ucchinna mūlo tālā vatthu kataḥ anabhāvaṅkataḥ āyatim an uppāda dhammo
translated: ‘Lust has been given up by me, cut off at the root, made like a palm stump, obliterated so that it’s no more subject to future arising.🔽‘Anger has been given up by me, cut off at the root, made like a palm stump, obliterated so that it’s no more subject to future arising.

original: moho me pahīno ucchinnamūlo tālāvatthukato anabhāvaṅkato āyatiṁ anuppādadhammo’.
analyzed: mohaḥ me pahīnaḥ ucchinna mūlo tālā vatthu kataḥ anabhāvaṅkataḥ āyatim an uppāda dhammo
translated: ‘Delusion has been given up by me, cut off at the root, made like a palm stump, obliterated so that it’s no more subject to future arising.’

original: So ce ahaṁ, brāhmaṇa, evaṁbhūto caṅkamāmi, ariyo me eso tasmiṁ samaye caṅkamo hoti.
analyzed: saḥ ce aha brāhmaṇaḥ eva bhūtaḥ caṅkamāmi ariyaḥ me esaḥ tasmin samaye caṅkamaḥ hoti
translated: When I’m like this, if I walk, it’s an noble walking for me.

original: So ce ahaṁ, brāhmaṇa, evaṁbhūto tiṭṭhāmi …pe…
analyzed: saḥ ce aha brāhmaṇaḥ eva bhūto tiṭṭhāmi pe
translated: When I’m like this, if I stand …

original: nisīdāmi …pe…
analyzed: nisīdāmi pe
translated: if I sit …

original: seyyaṁ kappemi, ariyaṁ me etaṁ tasmiṁ samaye uccāsayanamahāsayanaṁ hoti.
analyzed: seyyam kappemi ariyam me etam tasmin samaye uccāsayana mahāsayanam hoti
translated: if I lie down, it’s an noble bed and chair for me.

original: Idaṁ kho, brāhmaṇa, ariyaṁ uccāsayanamahāsayanaṁ, yassāhaṁ etarahi nikāmalābhī akicchalābhī akasiralābhī”ti.
analyzed: idam kho brāhmaṇa ariyam uccāsayana mahāsayana yassa aham etarahi nikāma lābhī a kiccha lābhī a kasira lābhī iti
translated: This is the noble bed and chair that I now enjoy at will, without trouble or difficulty.”

original: “Acchariyaṁ, bho gotama, abbhutaṁ, bho gotama.
analyzed: acchariya bho gotama abbhuta bho gotama
translated: “It’s astounding and amazing, Master Gotama!

original: Ko cañño evarūpassa ariyassa uccāsayanamahāsayanassa nikāmalābhī bhavissati akicchalābhī akasiralābhī, aññatra bhotā gotamena.
analyzed: kaḥ caññaḥ evarūpassa ariyassa uccāsayana mahāsayanassa nikāma lābhī bhavissati akiccha lābhī akasira lābhī aññatra bhotā gotamena
translated: Who else but Master Gotama could obtain such an excellent, high and wide bed so easily, without trouble or difficulty?

original: Abhikkantaṁ, bho gotama, abhikkantaṁ, bho gotama.🔽Seyyathāpi, bho gotama, nikkujjitaṁ vā ukkujjeyya, paṭicchannaṁ vā vivareyya, mūḷhassa
analyzed: abhikkanta bho gotama abhikkanta bho gotama  seyyathā api bho gotama nikkujjitam vā ukkujjeyya paṭicchannam vā vivareyya mūḷhassa
translated: Excellent, Master Gotama! Excellent, Master Gotama!

original: vā maggaṁ ācikkheyya, andhakāre vā telapajjotaṁ dhāreyya: ‘cakkhumanto rūpāni dakkhantī’ti;
analyzed: vā maggam ācikkheyya andhakāre vā tela pajjotam dhāreyya cakkhumantaḥ rūpāni dakkhanti iti
translated: Just as if he were to place upright what was overturned, to reveal what was hidden, to show the way to one who was lost, or to carry a lamp into the dark so that those with eyes could see forms,

original: evamevaṁ kho bhotā gotamena anekapariyāyena dhammo pakāsito.
analyzed: evam evam kho bhotā gotamena aneka pariyāyena dhammo pakāsito
translated: in the same way has Master Gotama—through many lines of reasoning—made the Dhamma clear.

original: Ete mayaṁ bhavantaṁ gotamaṁ saraṇaṁ gacchāma dhammañca bhikkhusaṅghañca.🔽Upāsake no bhavaṁ gotamo dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇupete saraṇaṁ gate”ti.
analyzed: ete mayam bhavantam gotamam saraṇam gacchāma dhammañca bhikkhu saṅghañca  upāsake naḥ bhavam gotamaḥ dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇupete saraṇam gatā iti
translated: We go to Master Gotama for refuge and to the Dhamma and to the Sangha of bhikkhus.

original: Tatiyaṁ.
analyzed: tatiya
translated: May Master Gotama remember us as lay followers who have gone to him for refuge, from this day forward, for life.”🔽The third section for recitation on the brahmins is finished.

original: Aṅguttara Nikāya 3.64
analyzed: aṅguttara nikāya
translated: The Book of the Sixes

original: 7. Mahāvagga
analyzed: mahāvagga
translated: The Greater Section

original: Sarabhasutta
analyzed: sarabhasutta
translated: With Sarabhanga

original: Evaṁ me sutaṁ—
analyzed: evam me suta
translated: Thus have I heard.

original: ekaṁ samayaṁ bhagavā rājagahe viharati gijjhakūṭe pabbate.
analyzed: ekam samayam bhagavā rājagahe viharati gijjhakūṭe pabbate
translated: On one occasion the Blessed One was dwelling at Rajagaha on the Vulture Peak Mountain.

original: Tena kho pana samayena sarabho nāma paribbājako acirapakkanto hoti imasmā dhammavinayā.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena sarabhaḥ nāma paribbājakaḥ acira pakkantaḥ hoti imasmai dhamma vinayā
translated: At that time, a wanderer named Sarabha had recently left the Buddha’s presence.

original: So rājagahe parisati evaṁ vācaṁ bhāsati:
analyzed: saḥ rājagahe parisati evam vācam bhāsati
translated: And in the assembly at Rājagaha he said this:

original: “aññāto mayā samaṇānaṁ sakyaputtikānaṁ dhammo.
analyzed: aññātaḥ mayā samaṇānam sakya puttikānam dhammo
translated: “I’ve understood the Teaching of the Sakyan monastics.

original: Aññāya ca panāhaṁ samaṇānaṁ sakyaputtikānaṁ dhammaṁ evāhaṁ tasmā dhammavinayā apakkanto”ti.
analyzed: aññāya ca pana aham samaṇānam sakya puttikānam dhammam eva aham tasmā dhamma vinayā apakkanto ti
translated: And because I’ve understood it, I’ve left that spiritual path.”

original: Atha kho sambahulā bhikkhū pubbaṇhasamayaṁ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya rājagahaṁ piṇḍāya pavisiṁsu.
analyzed: atha kho sambahulāḥ bhikkhū pubbaṇha samayam nivāsetvā patta cīvaram ādāya rājagaham piṇḍāya pavisisu
translated: Soon afterwards, after robing up in the morning, a number of monks took their bowls and robes and entered Rājagaha for alms.

original: Assosuṁ kho te bhikkhū sarabhassa paribbājakassa rājagahe parisati evaṁ vācaṁ bhāsamānassa:
analyzed: assosum kho te bhikkhū sarabhassa paribbājakassa rājagahe parisati evam vācam bhāsamānassa
translated: They heard Sarabha the wanderer speaking in the assembly at Rājagaha in this way.

original: “aññāto mayā samaṇānaṁ sakyaputtikānaṁ dhammo.
analyzed: aññātaḥ mayā samaṇānam sakya puttikānam dhammo
translated: “I’ve understood the Teaching of the Sakyan monastics.

original: Aññāya ca panāhaṁ samaṇānaṁ sakyaputtikānaṁ dhammaṁ evāhaṁ tasmā dhammavinayā apakkanto”ti.
analyzed: aññāya ca pana aham samaṇānam sakya puttikānam dhammam eva aham tasmā dhamma vinayā apakkanto ti
translated: And because I’ve understood it, I’ve left that spiritual path.”

original: Atha kho te bhikkhū rājagahe piṇḍāya caritvā pacchābhattaṁ piṇḍapātapaṭikkantā yena
analyzed: atha kho te bhikkhū rājagahe piṇḍāya caritvā pacchābhattam piṇḍapāta paṭikkantāḥ yena
translated: After their meal, those monks returned from their alms round.

original: bhagavā tenupasaṅkamiṁsu; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdiṁsu.
analyzed: bhagavā tena upasaṅkamisu upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantam abhivādetvā ekamantam nisīdisu
translated: and they approached the Buddha, bowed, and sat down.

original: Ekamantaṁ nisinnā kho te bhikkhū bhagavantaṁ etadavocuṁ:
analyzed: ekamantam nisinnāḥ kho te bhikkhū bhagavantam etat avocuḥ
translated: Seated, they said to the Buddha,

original: “sarabho nāma, bhante, paribbājako acirapakkanto imasmā dhammavinayā.
analyzed: sarabhaḥ nāma bhante paribbājakaḥ acira pakkantaḥ imasmai dhamma vinayā
translated: “Venerable Sir, the wanderer Sarabha has recently left this Dhamma and Discipline.

original: So rājagahe parisati evaṁ vācaṁ bhāsati:
analyzed: saḥ rājagahe parisati evam vācam bhāsati
translated: In Rājagaha he says this:

original: ‘aññāto mayā samaṇānaṁ sakyaputtikānaṁ dhammo.
analyzed: aññātaḥ mayā samaṇānam sakya puttikānam dhammo
translated: ‘I’ve understood the Teaching of the Sakyan monastics.

original: Aññāya ca panāhaṁ samaṇānaṁ sakyaputtikānaṁ dhammaṁ evāhaṁ tasmā dhammavinayā apakkanto’ti.
analyzed: aññāya ca pana aham samaṇānam sakya puttikānam dhammam eva aham tasmā dhamma vinayā apakkanto ti
translated: And because I’ve understood it, I’ve left that Dhamma and Discipline.’

original: Sādhu, bhante, bhagavā yena sippinikātīraṁ paribbājakārāmo yena sarabho paribbājako tenupasaṅkamatu anukampaṁ upādāyā”ti.
analyzed: sādhu bhante bhagavā yena sippinikā tīram paribbājaka ārāmaḥ yena sarabhaḥ paribbājako tena upasaṅkamatu anukampam upādāya ati
translated: Sir, it would be good if you went to the wanderers’ park at the Peacocks’ Feeding Ground to show compassion for Sarabha.”

original: Adhivāsesi bhagavā tuṇhībhāvena.
analyzed: adhivāsesi bhagavā tuṇhībhāvena
translated: The Buddha consented in silence.

original: Atha kho bhagavā sāyanhasamayaṁ paṭisallānā vuṭṭhito yena sippinikātīraṁ paribbājakārāmo
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā sāyanha samayam paṭisallānā vuṭṭhitaḥ yena sippinikā tīram paribbājaka ārāmaḥ
translated: Then, when it was evening, the Buddha rose from meditation and went to the wanderers’ park at the Peacocks’ Feeding Ground.

original: yena sarabho paribbājako tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi. Nisajja
analyzed: yena sarabhaḥ paribbājako tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi nisajja
translated: and he sat down on the prepared seat.

original: kho bhagavā sarabhaṁ paribbājakaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: kho bhagavā sarabham paribbājakam etat avoca
translated: The Buddha said to him,

original: “saccaṁ kira tvaṁ, sarabha, evaṁ vadesi:
analyzed: saccam kira tva sarabhaḥ evam vadesi
translated: “Sarabha, is it true that you say this?”

original: ‘aññāto mayā samaṇānaṁ sakyaputtikānaṁ dhammo.
analyzed: aññātaḥ mayā samaṇānam sakya puttikānam dhammo
translated: “I’ve understood the Teaching of the Sakyan monastics.

original: Aññāya ca panāhaṁ samaṇānaṁ sakyaputtikānaṁ dhammaṁ evāhaṁ tasmā dhammavinayā apakkanto’”ti?
analyzed: aññāya ca pana aham samaṇānam sakya puttikānam dhammam eva aham tasmā dhamma vinayā apakkanto ti
translated: And because I’ve understood it, I’ve left their training and their Teaching and their Monastic Code.”

original: Evaṁ vutte, sarabho paribbājako tuṇhī ahosi.
analyzed: evam vutte sarabhaḥ paribbājako tuṇhī ahosi
translated: When he said this, Sarabha was silent.

original: Dutiyampi kho bhagavā sarabhaṁ paribbājakaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: dutiyam pi kho bhagavā sarabham paribbājakam etat avoca
translated: A second time the Buddha said to him,

original: “vadehi, sarabha, kinti te aññāto samaṇānaṁ sakyaputtikānaṁ dhammo?🔽Sace te aparipūraṁ bhavissati, ahaṁ paripūressāmi.
analyzed: vadehi sarabha kinti te aññātaḥ samaṇānam sakya puttikānam dhammo  sace te a paripūram bhavissati aham paripūressāmi
translated: “Sarabha, tell me, what have you understood about the Teaching of the Sakyan monastics?🔽If it’s incomplete, I’ll complete it for you.

original: Sace pana te paripūraṁ bhavissati, ahaṁ anumodissāmī”ti.
analyzed: sace pana te paripūram bhavissati aham anumodissāmi iti
translated: If it’s complete, I’ll confirm it.”

original: Dutiyampi kho sarabho paribbājako tuṇhī ahosi.
analyzed: dutiyam pi kho sarabhaḥ paribbājako tuṇhī ahosi
translated: A second time Sarabha was silent.

original: Tatiyampi kho bhagavā sarabhaṁ paribbājakaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: tatiyam pi khalu bhagavā sarabham paribbājakam etat avoca
translated: A third time the Buddha said to him,

original: “yo kho, sarabha, paññāyati samaṇānaṁ sakyaputtikānaṁ dhammo vadehi, sarabha, kinti te aññāto samaṇānaṁ sakyaputtikānaṁ dhammo?🔽Sace te aparipūraṁ bhavissati, ahaṁ paripūressāmi.
analyzed: yaḥ kho sarabha paññāyati samaṇānam sakya puttikānam dhammaḥ vadehi sarabha kinti te aññātaḥ samaṇānam sakya puttikānam dhammo  sace te a paripūram bhavissati aham paripūressāmi
translated: “Sarabha, you know the Dhamma of the Sakyan monastics. Tell me, what have you understood about the Dhamma of the Sakyan monastics?🔽If it’s incomplete, I’ll complete it for you.

original: Sace pana te paripūraṁ bhavissati, ahaṁ anumodissāmī”ti.
analyzed: sace pana te paripūram bhavissati aham anumodissāmi iti
translated: If it’s complete, I’ll give my approval.”

original: Tatiyampi kho sarabho paribbājako tuṇhī ahosi.
analyzed: tatiyam pi kho sarabhaḥ paribbājako tuṇhī ahosi
translated: For a third time Sarabha was silent.

original: Atha kho te paribbājakā sarabhaṁ paribbājakaṁ etadavocuṁ:
analyzed: atha kho te paribbājakā sarabham paribbājakam etat avocu
translated: The wanderers then said to him,

original: “yadeva kho tvaṁ, āvuso sarabha, samaṇaṁ gotamaṁ yāceyyāsi tadeva te samaṇo gotamo pavāreti.
analyzed: yat eva khalu tvam āvuso sarabha samaṇam gotamam yāceyyāsi tat eva te samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ pavāra iti
translated: “You’ve asked the Buddha, and he’s invited you to tell him.

original: Vadehāvuso sarabha, kinti te aññāto samaṇānaṁ sakyaputtikānaṁ dhammo?🔽Sace te aparipūraṁ bhavissati, samaṇo gotamo paripūressati.
analyzed: vadeha āvuso sarabha kinti te aññātaḥ samaṇānam sakya puttikānam dhammo  sace te a paripūram bhavissati samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ paripūressati
translated: Tell us, what have you understood about the Dhamma of the Sakyan monastics?🔽If it’s incomplete, he’ll complete it for you.

original: Sace pana te paripūraṁ bhavissati, samaṇo gotamo anumodissatī”ti.
analyzed: sace pana te paripūram bhavissati samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ anumodissati iti
translated: If it’s complete, he’ll give his approval.”

original: Evaṁ vutte, sarabho paribbājako tuṇhībhūto maṅkubhūto pattakkhandho adhomukho pajjhāyanto appaṭibhāno nisīdi.
analyzed: evam vutte sarabhaḥ paribbājakaḥ tuṇhībhūtaḥ maṅku bhūtaḥ patta kkhandhaḥ adhomukhaḥ pajjhāyantaḥ appaṭibhānaḥ nisīdi
translated: When this was said, the wanderer Sarabha sat silent, dismayed, shoulders drooping, downcast, depressed, with nothing to say.

original: Atha kho bhagavā sarabhaṁ paribbājakaṁ tuṇhībhūtaṁ maṅkubhūtaṁ pattakkhandhaṁ adhomukhaṁ pajjhāyantaṁ appaṭibhānaṁ viditvā te paribbājake etadavoca:
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā sarabham paribbājakam tuṇhībhūtam maṅku bhūtam patta kkhandham adhomukham pajjhāyantam appaṭibhānam viditvā te paribbājake etat avoca
translated: Then, knowing that the wanderer Sarabha was silent, dismayed, shoulders drooping, downcast, depressed, with nothing to say, the Blessed One said to the wanderers:

original: “Yo kho maṁ, paribbājakā, evaṁ vadeyya:
analyzed: yaḥ kho ma paribbājakāḥ evam vadeyya
translated: “Wanderers, if anyone were to say of me:

original: ‘sammāsambuddhassa te paṭijānato ime dhammā anabhisambuddhā’ti, tamahaṁ tattha sādhukaṁ samanuyuñjeyyaṁ samanugāheyyaṁ samanubhāseyyaṁ.
analyzed: sammāsambuddhassa te paṭijānataḥ ime dhammāḥ an abhisambuddhāḥ ati tam aham tattha sādhukam samanuyuñjeyyam samanugāheyyam samanubhāseyya
translated: ‘While the recluse Gotama claims to be fully enlightened, these things are not fully awakened to by him,’

original: So vata mayā sādhukaṁ samanuyuñjiyamāno samanugāhiyamāno samanubhāsiyamāno aṭṭhānametaṁ
analyzed: saḥ vata mayā sādhukam samanuyuñjiyamānaḥ samanugāhiyamānaḥ samanubhāsiyamānaḥ aṭṭhānam eta
translated: then, if he were properly pressed and questioned and examined by me about this statement,🔽it would end in four ways for him:

original: anavakāso yaṁ so tiṇṇaṁ ṭhānānaṁ nāññataraṁ ṭhānaṁ nigaccheyya, aññena vā aññaṁ paṭicarissati,
analyzed: anavakāsaḥ yam saḥ tiṇṇam ṭhānānam na aññataram ṭhānam nigaccheyya aññena vā aññam paṭicarissati
translated: either he would be confused and admit he doesn’t know, or he would adopt some evasive technique, or he would go on stubbornly insisting, or he would leave the discussion.

original: bahiddhā kathaṁ apanāmessati, kopañca dosañca appaccayañca pātukarissati, tuṇhībhūto
analyzed: bahiddhā katham apanāmessati kopam ca dosam ca appaccayam ca pātukarissati tuṇhībhūtaḥ
translated: how will he turn the conversation to something else, how will he show anger, hate, and bitterness, how will he remain silent,

analyzed: maṅku bhūtaḥ pattakkhandhaḥ adhomukhaḥ pajjhāyantaḥ appaṭibhānaḥ nisīdissati seyyathā api
translated: how will he deflect the discussion to another topic, how will he show anger, revenge, and exasperation, how will he sit down in silence,

original: sarabho paribbājako.
analyzed: sarabhaḥ paribbājako
translated: like the wanderer Sarabha?

original: Yo kho maṁ, paribbājakā, evaṁ vadeyya:
analyzed: yaḥ kho ma paribbājakāḥ evam vadeyya
translated: Wanderers, if someone were to say of me:

original: ‘khīṇāsavassa te paṭijānato ime āsavā aparikkhīṇā’ti, tamahaṁ tattha sādhukaṁ samanuyuñjeyyaṁ samanugāheyyaṁ samanubhāseyyaṁ.🔽So vata mayā sādhukaṁ samanuyuñjiyamāno samanugāhiyamāno samanubhāsiyamāno aṭṭhānametaṁ
analyzed: khīṇa asavassa te paṭijānataḥ ime āsavāḥ a parikkhīṇā ti tam aham tattha sādhukam samanuyuñjeyyam samanugāheyyam samanubhāseyya  saḥ vata mayā sādhukam samanuyuñjiyamānaḥ samanugāhiyamānaḥ samanubhāsiyamānaḥ aṭṭhānam eta
translated: ‘While you claim to be free of defilements, these defilements are not yet ended,’ I would thoroughly investigate that with him, I would thoroughly question him, I would thoroughly grill him.🔽But it is impossible, friend, it cannot happen, that one who is thoroughly investigated, thoroughly questioned, thoroughly grilled by me would sit down in one of three situations:

original: anavakāso yaṁ so tiṇṇaṁ ṭhānānaṁ nāññataraṁ ṭhānaṁ nigaccheyya, aññena vā aññaṁ paṭicarissati,
analyzed: anavakāsaḥ yam saḥ tiṇṇam ṭhānānam na aññataram ṭhānam nigaccheyya aññena vā aññam paṭicarissati
translated: he would either refute what I have said and propose another view,

original: bahiddhā kathaṁ apanāmessati, kopañca dosañca appaccayañca pātukarissati, tuṇhībhūto
analyzed: bahiddhā katham apanāmessati kopam ca dosam ca appaccayam ca pātukarissati tuṇhībhūtaḥ
translated: how will he deflect the discussion to another topic, how will he show anger, revenge, and exasperation, how will he sit down in silence,

original: maṅkubhūto pattakkhandho adhomukho pajjhāyanto appaṭibhāno nisīdissati, seyyathāpi
analyzed: maṅku bhūtaḥ pattakkhandhaḥ adhomukhaḥ pajjhāyantaḥ appaṭibhānaḥ nisīdissati seyyathā api
translated: He’ll sit there dejected, shoulders drooping, his mind collapsed, downcast, without words,

original: sarabho paribbājako.
analyzed: sarabhaḥ paribbājako
translated: just like the wanderer Sarabha.”

original: Yo kho maṁ, paribbājakā, evaṁ vadeyya:
analyzed: yaḥ kho ma paribbājakāḥ evam vadeyya
translated: “Wanderers, if someone were to say to me,

original: ‘yassa kho pana te atthāya dhammo desito, so na niyyāti takkarassa sammā dukkhakkhayāyā’ti, tamahaṁ tattha sādhukaṁ samanuyuñjeyyaṁ samanugāheyyaṁ samanubhāseyyaṁ.🔽So vata mayā sādhukaṁ samanuyuñjiyamāno samanugāhiyamāno samanubhāsiyamāno aṭṭhānametaṁ
analyzed: yassa kho pana te atthāya dhammo desito so na niyyāti takkarassa sammā dukkha kkhayāya ati tam aham tattha sādhukam samanuyuñjeyyam samanugāheyyam samanubhāseyya  saḥ vata mayā sādhukam samanuyuñjiyamānaḥ samanugāhiyamānaḥ samanubhāsiyamānaḥ aṭṭhānam eta
translated: ‘The one for whom you teach the Dhamma doesn’t go forth into homelessness for the sake of realizing a supreme freedom from bonds,’ I would thoroughly question, investigate, and cross-examine them about this.🔽But it’s impossible for them to go beyond the three ways of answering: either by answering the question, by asking a counter-question in return,

original: anavakāso yaṁ so tiṇṇaṁ ṭhānānaṁ nāññataraṁ ṭhānaṁ nigaccheyya, aññena vā aññaṁ paṭicarissati,🔽bahiddhā kathaṁ apanāmessati, kopañca dosañca appaccayañca pātukarissati, tuṇhībhūto
analyzed: anavakāsaḥ yam saḥ tiṇṇam ṭhānānam na aññataram ṭhānam nigaccheyya aññena vā aññam paṭicarissati  bahiddhā katham apanāmessati kopam ca dosam ca appaccayam ca pātukarissati tuṇhībhūtaḥ
translated: or by leaving it aside.

analyzed: maṅku bhūtaḥ pattakkhandhaḥ adhomukhaḥ pajjhāyantaḥ appaṭibhānaḥ nisīdissati seyyathā api
translated: They’ll sit there dejected, shoulders drooping, their mind collapsed, downcast, without words,

original: sarabho paribbājako”ti.
analyzed: sarabho paribbājako ti
translated: just like the wanderer Sarabha.”

original: Atha kho bhagavā sippinikātīre paribbājakārāme tikkhattuṁ sīhanādaṁ naditvā vehāsaṁ pakkāmi.
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā sippinikā tīre paribbājaka ārāme tikkhattum sīha nādam naditvā vehāsam pakkāmi
translated: Then, after roaring his lion’s roar three times, the Buddha flew up into the air and departed.

original: Atha kho te paribbājakā acirapakkantassa bhagavato sarabhaṁ paribbājakaṁ samantato vācāyasannitodakena sañjambharimakaṁsu:
analyzed: atha kho te paribbājakāḥ acira pakkantassa bhagavataḥ sarabham paribbājakam samantataḥ vācāya sannita udakena
translated: Soon after he had left, the monastics surrounded Sarabha and scolded him:

original: “seyyathāpi, āvuso sarabha, brahāraññe jarasiṅgālo ‘sīhanādaṁ nadissāmī’ti siṅgālakaṁyeva nadati, bheraṇḍakaṁyeva nadati;🔽evamevaṁ kho tvaṁ, āvuso sarabha, aññatreva samaṇena gotamena ‘sīhanādaṁ nadissāmī’ti siṅgālakaṁyeva nadasi bheraṇḍakaṁyeva nadasi.
analyzed: seyyathā api āvuso sarabha brahāraññe jarasiṅgālaḥ sīha nādam nadissāmi iti siṅgālakayā iva nadati bheraṇḍakayā iva nadati  evam evam kho tvam āvuso sarabha aññatra iva samaṇena gotamena sīha nādam nadissāmi iti siṅgālakayā iva nadasi bheraṇḍakayā iva nadasi
translated: “Sarabha, just as an old jackal in the wilderness thinks, ‘I’ll howl like a lion,’ but only howls and yaps like a jackal,🔽so you think, ‘I’ll roar like the Buddha,’ but you only howl and yap like a jackal.

original: Seyyathāpi, āvuso sarabha, ambukasañcarī ‘purisakaravitaṁ ravissāmī’ti ambukasañcariravitaṁyeva ravati;
analyzed: sā iyyathā api āvuso sarabha ambuka sañcarī purisaka ravitam ravissāmi iti ambuka sañcari ravitayā iva ravati
translated: Just as a frog in a well thinks, ‘I’ll croak like a bull,’ but only croaks like a frog,

original: evamevaṁ kho tvaṁ, āvuso sarabha, aññatreva samaṇena gotamena ‘purisakaravitaṁ ravissāmī’ti, ambukasañcariravitaṁyeva ravasi.
analyzed: evam evam kho tvam āvuso sarabha aññatra iva samaṇena gotamena purisaka ravitam ravissāmi iti ambuka sañcari ravitayā iva ravasi
translated: so you think, ‘I’ll croak like a bull,’ but you only croak like a frog.

original: Seyyathāpi, āvuso sarabha, usabho suññāya gosālāya gambhīraṁ naditabbaṁ maññati;
analyzed: seyyathā api āvuso sarabhaḥ usabhaḥ suññāya gosālāya gambhīram naditabbam maññati
translated: Just as a bull thinks it can bellow deeply in an empty cowshed,

original: evamevaṁ kho tvaṁ, āvuso sarabha, aññatreva samaṇena gotamena gambhīraṁ naditabbaṁ maññasī”ti.
analyzed: evam evam kho tvaṃ āvuso sarabha aññatra iva samaṇena gotamena gambhīram naditabbam maññasi iti
translated: so you think you can bellow deeply only when the Buddha is not here.”

original: Atha kho te paribbājakā sarabhaṁ paribbājakaṁ samantato vācāyasannitodakena sañjambharimakaṁsūti.
analyzed: atha kho te paribbājakā sarabham paribbājakam samantataḥ vācāya sannita udakena
translated: Then the wanderers surrounded the wanderer Sarabha on all sides and scolded him, heaping criticism on him.

original: Catutthaṁ.
analyzed: catuttha
translated: The fourth.🔽🔽

analyzed: aṅguttara nikāya

original: 7. Mahāvagga
analyzed: mahāvagga
translated: The Greater Division

original: Kesamuttisutta
analyzed: kesamutti sutta
translated: At Kesaputta

original: Evaṁ me sutaṁ—
analyzed: evam me suta
translated: Thus have I heard.

original: ekaṁ samayaṁ bhagavā kosalesu cārikaṁ caramāno mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṁ yena kesamuttaṁ nāma kālāmānaṁ nigamo tadavasari.
analyzed: ekam samayam bhagavā kosalesu cārikam caramānaḥ mahatā bhikkhu saṅghena saddhim yena kesamuttam nāma kālāmānam nigamaḥ tat avasari
translated: On one occasion the Blessed One was wandering among the Kālāmas with a large Saṅgha of bhikkhus, and eventually he arrived at a town of the Kālāmas named Kesaputta.

original: Assosuṁ kho kesamuttiyā kālāmā:
analyzed: assosum kho kesamuttiyā kālāmā
translated: The Kālāmas of Kesaputta heard:

original: “samaṇo khalu, bho, gotamo sakyaputto sakyakulā pabbajito kesamuttaṁ anuppatto.
analyzed: samaṇaḥ khalu bho gotamaḥ sakya putto sakya kulā pabbajitaḥ kesamuttam anuppatto
translated: “The recluse Gotama, the son of the Sakyans who went forth from a Sakyan clan, has been wandering in the Kālāma country with a large Saṅgha of bhikkhus and has come to Kesaputta.

original: Taṁ kho pana bhavantaṁ gotamaṁ evaṁ kalyāṇo kittisaddo abbhuggato:
analyzed: tam kha pana bhavantam gotamam evam kalyāṇaḥ kitti saddaḥ abbhuggataḥ
translated: Now a good report of Master Gotama has been spread to this effect:

original: ‘itipi so bhagavā …pe…
analyzed: saḥ bhagavān pe
translated: ‘That Blessed One is accomplished, fully enlightened, perfect in true knowledge and conduct, sublime, knower of worlds, incomparable leader of persons to be tamed, teacher of gods and humans, enlightened, blessed.🔽He declares this world with its gods, its Māras, and its Brahmās, this generation with its contemplatives and brahmans, its royalty and common people, which he has himself realized with direct knowledge.

original: sādhu kho pana tathārūpānaṁ arahataṁ dassanaṁ hotī’”ti.🔽Atha kho kesamuttiyā kālāmā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkamiṁsu; upasaṅkamitvā appekacce🔽bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdiṁsu, appekacce bhagavatā saddhiṁ sammodiṁsu,
analyzed: sādhu kho pana tathārūpānam arahatam dassanam hoti iti  atha kho kesamuttiyā kālāmā yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkamisu upasaṅkamitvā appekacce  bhagavantam abhivādetvā ekamantam nisīdisu appekacce bhagavatā saddhim sammodisu
translated: It’s good to see such perfected ones.’”🔽Then the Kālāmas of Kesaputta went up to the Buddha. Some bowed down to the Buddha and sat down to one side.

original: sammodanīyaṁ kathaṁ sāraṇīyaṁ vītisāretvā ekamantaṁ nisīdiṁsu, appekacce yena bhagavā
analyzed: sammodanīyam katham sāraṇīyam vītisāretvā ekamantam nisīdisu appekacce yena bhagavā
translated: Some exchanged greetings with him and, after the greetings and polite conversation were over, sat down to one side. Some raised their joined palms to the Buddha and sat down to one side.

original: tenañjaliṁ paṇāmetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdiṁsu, appekacce nāmagottaṁ sāvetvā ekamantaṁ🔽nisīdiṁsu, appekacce tuṇhībhūtā ekamantaṁ nisīdiṁsu. Ekamantaṁ nisinnā kho te kesamuttiyā
analyzed: tena añjalim paṇāmetvā ekamantam appekacce nāma gottam sāvetvā ekamantam  nisīdisu appekacce tuṇhībhūtāḥ ekamantam nisīdisu ekamantam nisinnāḥ kho te kesamuttiyā
translated: Some announced their name and family and sat down to one side. Some remained silent and sat down to one side.

original: kālāmā bhagavantaṁ etadavocuṁ:
analyzed: kālāmāḥ bhagavantam etat avocuḥ
translated: When they were seated, they said to the Buddha,

original: “Santi, bhante, eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā kesamuttaṁ āgacchanti.
analyzed: santi bhante eke samaṇa brāhmaṇā kesamuttam āgacchanti
translated: “Sir, some ascetics and brahmins who come to Kesaputta

original: Te sakaṁyeva vādaṁ dīpenti jotenti, parappavādaṁ pana khuṁsenti vambhenti paribhavanti omakkhiṁ karonti.
analyzed: te sakayā iva vādam dīpenti jotenti para pavādam pana khusenti vambhenti paribhavanti omakkhim karonti
translated: explain and elucidate their own doctrines, but disparage, denigrate, deride, and condemn the doctrines of others.

original: Aparepi, bhante, eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā kesamuttaṁ āgacchanti.
analyzed: apare pi bhante eke samaṇa brāhmaṇā kesamuttam āgacchanti
translated: “There are some ascetics and brahmins who come to Kesaputta.

original: Tepi sakaṁyeva vādaṁ dīpenti jotenti, parappavādaṁ pana khuṁsenti vambhenti paribhavanti omakkhiṁ karonti.
analyzed: te api sakayā iva vādam dīpenti jotenti para pavādam pana khusenti vambhenti paribhavanti omakkhim karonti
translated: They too illuminate and make shine their own doctrines, but they disparage, denigrate, deride, and denounce the doctrines of others.

original: Tesaṁ no, bhante, amhākaṁ hoteva kaṅkhā hoti vicikicchā:
analyzed: tesam naḥ bhante amhākam hotā iva kaṅkhā hoti vicikicchā
translated: We are doubtful and perplexed, venerable sir,

original: ‘ko su nāma imesaṁ bhavataṁ samaṇabrāhmaṇānaṁ saccaṁ āha, ko musā’”ti?
analyzed: kaḥ su nāma imesam bhavatam samaṇa brāhmaṇānam āha kaḥ musā ati
translated: as to which of these good ascetics speak the truth and which speak falsehood.”

original: “Alañhi vo, kālāmā, kaṅkhituṁ alaṁ vicikicchituṁ.
analyzed: alam hi vaḥ kālāmā kaṅkhitum alam vicikicchitu
translated: “It is fitting for you to be doubtful, Kālāmas, fitting for you to be perplexed.

original: Kaṅkhanīyeva pana vo ṭhāne vicikicchā uppannā.🔽Etha tumhe, kālāmā, mā anussavena, mā paramparāya, mā itikirāya, mā piṭakasampadānena,
analyzed: kaṅkhanīyā iva pana vaḥ ṭhāne vicikicchā uppannā  tumhe kālāmā mā anussavena mā paramparāya mā itikirāya mā piṭaka sampadānena
translated: Doubt has arisen in you about a doubtful matter.🔽Come, Kālāmas.

original: mā takkahetu, mā nayahetu, mā ākāraparivitakkena, mā diṭṭhinijjhānakkhantiyā, mā
analyzed: mā takka hetu mā naya hetu mā ākāra parivitakkena mā diṭṭhi nijjhāna khantiyā mā
translated: Do not go by oral tradition, by lineage of teaching, by hearsay, by a collection of scriptures, by logical reasoning, by inferential reasoning, by reasoned cogitation, by the acceptance of a view after pondering it, by the seeming competence of a speaker, or because you think:

original: bhabbarūpatāya, mā samaṇo no garūti.
analyzed: bhabbarūpatāya mā samaṇaḥ naḥ garūti
translated: ‘The ascetic is our guru.’

original: Yadā tumhe, kālāmā, attanāva jāneyyātha:
analyzed: yadā tumhe kālāmā attana ava jāneyyātha
translated: But when you know for yourselves:

original: ‘ime dhammā akusalā, ime dhammā sāvajjā, ime dhammā viññugarahitā, ime dhammā samattā samādinnā ahitāya dukkhāya saṁvattantī’ti, atha tumhe, kālāmā, pajaheyyātha.
analyzed: ime dhammā akusalāḥ ime dhammā sāvajjāḥ ime dhammāḥ viññuga rahitāḥ ime dhammā samattā samādinnā ahitāya dukkhāya savattanti iti atha tumhe kālāmā pajaheyyātha
translated: ‘These things are unwholesome, blameworthy, censured by the wise, when undertaken and performed lead to harm and suffering,’ then you should abandon them.

original: Taṁ kiṁ maññatha, kālāmā,
analyzed: tam kim maññatha kālāmā
translated: What do you think, Kalamas?

original: lobho purisassa ajjhattaṁ uppajjamāno uppajjati hitāya vā ahitāya vā”ti?
analyzed: lobho purisassa ajjhattam uppajjamānaḥ uppajjati hitāya vā ahitāya vā ati
translated: When greed arises in a person, is it for his benefit or harm?”

original: “Ahitāya, bhante”.
analyzed: ahitāya bhante
translated: “For his harm, Bhante.”

original: “Luddho panāyaṁ, kālāmā, purisapuggalo lobhena abhibhūto pariyādinnacitto pāṇampi
analyzed: luddhaḥ panāya kālāmā purisa puggalo lobhena abhibhūto pariyādinna citto pāṇam pi
translated: “A greedy person, overcome by greed, with mind obsessed by it, destroys life,

original: hanati, adinnampi ādiyati, paradārampi gacchati, musāpi bhaṇati, parampi tathattāya
analyzed: hanati adinnam pi ādiyati paradāram pi gacchati musā api bhaṇati param pi tathattāya
translated: takes what is not given, engages in sexual misconduct, and tells lies;

original: samādapeti, yaṁ sa hoti dīgharattaṁ ahitāya dukkhāyā”ti.
analyzed: samādapeti yam sa hoti dīgharattam ahitāya dukkhāya ati
translated: and he encourages others to do likewise. This, for a long time, will lead to his harm and suffering.”

original: “Evaṁ, bhante”.
analyzed: eva bhante
translated: “Yes, Bhante.”

original: “Taṁ kiṁ maññatha, kālāmā,
analyzed: tam kim maññatha kālāmā
translated: “What do you think, Kalamas?

original: doso purisassa ajjhattaṁ uppajjamāno uppajjati hitāya vā ahitāya vā”ti?
analyzed: doso purisassa ajjhattam uppajjamānaḥ uppajjati hitāya vā ahitāya vā ati
translated: When hatred arises in a person, is it for his benefit or harm?”

original: “Ahitāya, bhante”.
analyzed: ahitāya bhante
translated: “For his harm, Bhante.”

original: “Duṭṭho panāyaṁ, kālāmā, purisapuggalo dosena abhibhūto pariyādinnacitto pāṇampi
analyzed: duṭṭhaḥ panāya kālāmā purisa puggalo dosena abhibhūto pariyādinna citto pāṇam pi
translated: “When a person is full of hate, overcome by hate, his mind is corrupted by hate. He kills living beings,🔽takes what is not given, engages in sexual misconduct, and tells lies.

original: hanati, adinnampi ādiyati, paradārampi gacchati, musāpi bhaṇati, parampi tathattāya
analyzed: hanati adinnam pi ādiyati paradāram pi gacchati musā api bhaṇati param pi tathattāya
translated: He encourages others to do the same, and so

analyzed: samādapeti yam sa hoti dīgharattam ahitāya dukkhāya ati

original: “Evaṁ, bhante”.
analyzed: eva bhante
translated: “Yes, lord.”

original: “Taṁ kiṁ maññatha, kālāmā,
analyzed: tam kim maññatha kālāmā
translated: “What do you think, Kalamas?

analyzed: mohaḥ purisassa ajjhattam uppajjamānaḥ uppajjati hitāya vā ahitāya vā ati

original: “Ahitāya, bhante”.
analyzed: ahitāya bhante
translated: “For his harm, lord.”

original: “Mūḷho panāyaṁ, kālāmā, purisapuggalo mohena abhibhūto pariyādinnacitto pāṇampi hanati,
analyzed: mūḍhaḥ panāya kālāmā purisa puggalo mohena abhibhūto pariyādinna citto pāṇam pi hanati
translated: “When a person is deluded, overcome by delusion, his mind is corrupted by delusion. He kills living beings,🔽takes what is not given, engages in sexual misconduct, and tells lies.

original: adinnampi ādiyati, paradārampi gacchati, musāpi bhaṇati, parampi tathattāya samādapeti,
analyzed: a dinnam api ādiyati para dāram pi gacchati musā api bhaṇati param pi tathattāya samādapeti
translated: He encourages others to do the same, and so

analyzed: yam sa hoti dīgharattam ahitāya dukkhāya ati
translated: he experiences pain and distress for a long time.”

original: “Evaṁ, bhante”.
analyzed: eva bhante
translated: “Yes, lord.”🔽“What do you think, Kalamas?

original: “Taṁ kiṁ maññatha, kālāmā, ime dhammā kusalā vā akusalā vā”ti?
analyzed: tam kim maññatha kālāmā ime dhammā kusalāḥ vā akusalāḥ vā ti
translated: Are these things skillful or unskillful?”

original: “Akusalā, bhante”.
analyzed: akusalāḥ bhante
translated: “Unskillful, lord.”

original: “Sāvajjā vā anavajjā vā”ti?

analyzed: yadā tumhe sāḍhāḥ attana ava jāneyyātha  ime dhammā kusalāḥ ime dhammāḥ anavajjāḥ ime dhammāḥ viññuppasatthāḥ ime dhammā samattā

translated: He is mindful, clearly comprehending, and knows for himself.🔽He lives in a secluded lodging, secluded from the laity.

translated: He is determined to be energetic, and he is strong in steady persistence.🔽He is wise, and his wisdom is about what is skillful and unskillful, about what is blameworthy and blameless, and about what is to be practiced and not to be practiced.🔽He is wise, and his wisdom is about the proper ending of suffering and stress.🔽He is one who has faith, a sense of conscience, prudence, energy, and wisdom.🔽He is one who has good friends, good companions, and good comrades.

original: tathā catutthaṁ, iti uddhamadho tiriyaṁ sabbadhi sabbattatāya sabbāvantaṁ lokaṁ upekkhāsahagatena
analyzed: tathā catutthaḥ iti uddham adhas tiriyam sabbadhi sabbattatāya sabbāvantam lokam upekkhā sahagatena
translated: He trains thus: ‘I shall breathe in calming bodily formation’; he trains thus: ‘I shall breathe out calming bodily formation.’🔽He trains thus: ‘I shall breathe in experiencing happiness’; he trains thus: ‘I shall breathe out experiencing happiness.’🔽He trains thus: ‘I shall breathe in experiencing bliss’; he trains thus: ‘I shall breathe out experiencing bliss.’🔽He trains thus: ‘I shall breathe in experiencing the mental formation’; he trains thus: ‘I shall breathe out experiencing the mental formation.’🔽He trains thus: ‘I shall breathe in calming the mental formation’; he trains thus: ‘I shall breathe out calming the mental formation.’🔽He trains thus: ‘I shall breathe in experiencing the mind’; he trains thus: ‘I shall breathe out experiencing the mind.’🔽He trains thus: ‘I shall breathe in gladdening the mind’; he trains thus: ‘I shall breathe out gladdening the mind.’🔽He trains thus: ‘I shall breathe in concentrating the mind’; he trains thus: ‘I shall breathe out concentrating the mind.’🔽He trains thus: ‘I shall breathe in liberating the mind’; he trains thus: ‘I shall breathe out liberating the mind.’

original: cetasā vipulena mahaggatena appamāṇena averena abyāpajjhena pharitvā viharati.🔽So evaṁ pajānāti:
analyzed: cetasā vipulena mahaggatena appamāṇena averena a byāpajjhena pharitvā viharati  saḥ evam pajānāti

analyzed: atthi ida atthi hīna atthi paṇīta atthi imassa saññāgatassa uttari nissaraṇanti  tassa evam jānataḥ evam passataḥ kāma āsavā api cittam vimuccati bhava āsavā api cittam vimuccati avijjā āsavā api cittam vimuccati
translated: He trains thus: ‘I shall breathe in contemplating fading away’; he trains thus: ‘I shall breathe out contemplating fading away.’🔽He trains thus: ‘I shall breathe in contemplating cessation’; he trains thus: ‘I shall breathe out contemplating cessation.’

original: vimuttasmiṁ vimuttamiti ñāṇaṁ hoti.🔽‘Khīṇā jāti, vusitaṁ brahmacariyaṁ, kataṁ karaṇīyaṁ, nāparaṁ itthattāyā’ti pajānāti.
analyzed: vimuttasmin vimuttam iti ñāṇam hoti  brahmacariya katam karaṇīya na aparam itthattāya ati pajānāti
translated: He trains thus: ‘I shall breathe in contemplating relinquishment’; he trains thus: ‘I shall breathe out contemplating relinquishment.’🔽He trains thus: ‘I shall breathe in experiencing the mind’; he trains thus: ‘I shall breathe out experiencing the mind.’🔽He trains thus: ‘I shall breathe in gladdening the mind’; he trains thus: ‘I shall breathe out gladdening the mind.’

original: So evaṁ pajānāti:🔽‘ahu pubbe lobho, tadahu akusalaṁ, so etarahi natthi, iccetaṁ kusalaṁ;
analyzed: saḥ evam pajānāti  ahu pubbe lobho tadahu akusala saḥ etarahi natthi icca etam kusala
translated: He trains thus: ‘I shall breathe in concentrating the mind’; he trains thus: ‘I shall breathe out concentrating the mind.’

original: ahu pubbe doso …pe…

translated: He trains thus: ‘I shall breathe in liberating the mind’; he

analyzed: ahu pubbe mohaḥ tadahu so etarahi natthi iccā itam kusalanti
translated: Previously there was delusion, which is unwholesome. Now that has gone, and this is wholesome.’

analyzed: so diṭṭhe iva dhamme nicchātaḥ nibbutaḥ sīti bhūtaḥ sukha ppaṭisavedī brahma bhūtena attanā viharati iti

analyzed: kathā sampayogena bhikkhave puggalaḥ veditabbaḥ yadi vā kacchaḥ yadi vā akacchaḥ ti

translated: or when stating what he has heard, or when stating what he has sensed, or when stating what he has cognised,🔽then he is a proper person.

original: Kathāsampayogena, bhikkhave, puggalo veditabbo yadi vā kaccho yadi vā akacchoti.🔽Sacāyaṁ, bhikkhave, puggalo pañhaṁ puṭṭho samāno aññenaññaṁ paṭicarati, bahiddhā
analyzed: kathā sampayogena bhikkhave puggalaḥ veditabbaḥ yadi vā kacchaḥ yadi vā akacchaḥ ti  bhikkhave puggalaḥ pañham puṭṭhaḥ samānaḥ aññena aññam paṭicarati bahiddhā
translated: “By his association in discussion, bhikkhus, one can know him as a proper person or as an improper person.🔽If, when questioned, he evades the question and does not answer it directly,

original: kathaṁ apanāmeti, kopañca dosañca appaccayañca pātukaroti, evaṁ santāyaṁ, bhikkhave,
analyzed: katham apanāmeti kopam ca dosam ca appaccayam ca pātukaroti evam santāya bhikkhave

analyzed: sace pana āya bhikkhave puggalaḥ pañham puṭṭhaḥ samānaḥ na aññena aññam paṭicarati na

analyzed: katame tayaḥ
translated: What three?

original: Rāgo, doso, moho—
analyzed: rāgaḥ dosaḥ mohaḥ
translated: Passion, aversion, and delusion.

original: ime kho, āvuso, tayo dhammā.
analyzed: ime kho āvuso tayaḥ dhammā
translated: These are the three things.

original: Imesaṁ, āvuso, tiṇṇaṁ dhammānaṁ ko viseso ko adhippayāso kiṁ nānākaraṇan’ti?
analyzed: imesaṃ āvuso tiṇṇam dhammānam kaḥ visesaḥ kaḥ adhippayāsaḥ kim nānākaraṇanti
translated: What is the difference between them? What is the distinction?”

original: Evaṁ puṭṭhā tumhe, bhikkhave, tesaṁ aññatitthiyānaṁ paribbājakānaṁ kinti byākareyyāthā”ti?🔽“Bhagavaṁmūlakā no, bhante, dhammā bhagavaṁnettikā bhagavaṁpaṭisaraṇā. Sādhu vata,
analyzed: evam puṭṭhāḥ tumhe bhikkhave tesam añña titthiyānam paribbājakānam kinti byākareyyātha ati  bhagava mūlakāḥ no bhante dhammāḥ bhagava nettikāḥ bhagava paṭisaraṇā sādhu vata
translated: If they ask you this, what would you answer?”

original: bhante, bhagavantaṁyeva paṭibhātu etassa bhāsitassa attho. Bhagavato sutvā bhikkhū dhāressantī”ti.
analyzed: bhante bhagavantayā iva paṭibhātu etassa bhāsitassa atthaḥ bhagavataḥ sutvā bhikkhū dhāressanti iti
translated: “Venerable sir, our teachings are rooted in the Blessed One, guided by the Blessed One, take recourse in the Blessed One. It would be good if the Blessed One would clear up the meaning of this statement. Having heard it from him, the bhikkhus will remember it.”

original: “Tena hi, bhikkhave, suṇātha, sādhukaṁ manasi karotha, bhāsissāmī”ti.
analyzed: tena hi bhikkhave suṇātha sādhukam manasi karotha bhāsissāmi iti
translated: “Then listen and attend closely to what I shall say.”

original: “Evaṁ, bhante”ti kho te bhikkhū bhagavato paccassosuṁ.
analyzed: eva bhante iti kho te bhikkhū bhagavato
translated: “Yes, venerable sir,” the bhikkhus replied.

original: Bhagavā etadavoca:
analyzed: bhagavān etat avoca
translated: The Blessed One said this:

original: “Sace, bhikkhave, aññatitthiyā paribbājakā evaṁ puccheyyuṁ:
analyzed: sace bhikkhave añña titthiyāḥ paribbājakāḥ evam puccheyyu
translated: “If wanderers of other sects ask you:

original: ‘tayome, āvuso, dhammā.
analyzed: tayo ume āvuso dhammā
translated: ‘Friends, there are these three things.

original: Katame tayo?
analyzed: katame tayaḥ
translated: What three?

original: Rāgo, doso, moho—
analyzed: rāgaḥ dosaḥ mohaḥ
translated: Lust, hatred, and delusion;

original: ime kho, āvuso, tayo dhammā;
analyzed: ime kho āvuso tayaḥ dhammā
translated: these are the three things;

original: imesaṁ, āvuso, tiṇṇaṁ dhammānaṁ ko viseso ko adhippayāso kiṁ nānākaraṇan’ti?
analyzed: imesaṃ āvuso tiṇṇam dhammānam kaḥ visesaḥ kaḥ adhippayāsaḥ kim nānākaraṇanti
translated: What is the difference between them? What is the distinction between them?’

original: Evaṁ puṭṭhā tumhe, bhikkhave, tesaṁ aññatitthiyānaṁ paribbājakānaṁ evaṁ byākareyyātha:
analyzed: evam puṭṭhāḥ tumhe bhikkhave tesam añña titthiyānam paribbājakānam evam byākareyyātha
translated: “If you were asked this, how would you answer?”

original: ‘rāgo kho, āvuso, appasāvajjo dandhavirāgī, doso mahāsāvajjo khippavirāgī, moho mahāsāvajjo dandhavirāgī’ti.
analyzed: rāgaḥ kho āvuso appa sāvajjaḥ dandha virāgī dosaḥ mahā sāvajjaḥ khippa virāgī mohaḥ mahā sāvajjaḥ dandha virāgī iti
translated: ‘Lust is less blameworthy and slower to fade, while hatred is more blameworthy and quicker to fade, and delusion is more blameworthy and slower to fade.’

original: ‘Ko panāvuso, hetu ko paccayo yena anuppanno vā rāgo uppajjati uppanno vā rāgo bhiyyobhāvāya vepullāya saṁvattatī’ti?
analyzed: kaḥ pana āvuso hetu kaḥ paccayaḥ yena anuppannaḥ vā rāgaḥ uppajjati uppannaḥ vā rāgaḥ bhiyyobhāvāya vepullāya savattati iti
translated: ‘What is the cause and condition, venerable friends, for the arising of lust that has not arisen and for the increase and expansion of lust that has arisen?’

original: ‘“Subhanimittan”tissa vacanīyaṁ.
analyzed: vacanīya
translated: ‘The sign of the beautiful, friend.’

original: Tassa subhanimittaṁ ayoniso manasi karoto anuppanno vā rāgo uppajjati uppanno vā rāgo bhiyyobhāvāya vepullāya saṁvattati.
analyzed: tassa subha nimittam ayonisas manasi karotaḥ anuppannaḥ vā rāgaḥ uppajjati uppannaḥ vā rāgaḥ bhiyyobhāvāya vepullāya savattati
translated: ‘When one attends carelessly to the sign of the beautiful, lust arises in one who is undeveloped in mind, and even if arisen, it increases and expands.

original: Ayaṁ kho, āvuso, hetu ayaṁ paccayo yena anuppanno vā rāgo uppajjati uppanno vā rāgo bhiyyobhāvāya vepullāya saṁvattatī’ti.
analyzed: ayam kho āvuso hetu ayam paccayaḥ yena anuppannaḥ vā rāgaḥ uppajjati uppannaḥ vā rāgaḥ bhiyyobhāvāya vepullāya savattati iti
translated: This is the cause and condition, venerable friends, for the arising of lust that has not arisen and for the increase and expansion of lust that has arisen.’

original: ‘Ko panāvuso, hetu ko paccayo yena anuppanno vā doso uppajjati uppanno vā doso bhiyyobhāvāya vepullāya saṁvattatī’ti?
analyzed: kaḥ pana āvuso hetu kaḥ paccayaḥ yena anuppannaḥ vā dosaḥ uppajjati uppannaḥ vā dosaḥ bhiyyobhāvāya vepullāya savattati iti
translated: ‘But what is the reason why, when there is ill-will, it arises and, when arisen, grows and increases?

original: ‘“Paṭighanimittan”tissa vacanīyaṁ.
analyzed: vacanīya
translated: ‘ ‘The sign of resistance, friend.’

original: Tassa paṭighanimittaṁ ayoniso manasi karoto anuppanno vā doso uppajjati uppanno vā doso bhiyyobhāvāya vepullāya saṁvattati.
analyzed: tassa paṭigha nimittam ayonisas manasi karotaḥ anuppannaḥ vā dosaḥ uppajjati uppannaḥ vā dosaḥ bhiyyobhāvāya vepullāya savattati
translated: ‘When one attends carelessly, ill-will arises and, when arisen, grows and increases.

original: Ayaṁ kho, āvuso, hetu ayaṁ paccayo yena anuppanno vā doso uppajjati uppanno vā doso bhiyyobhāvāya vepullāya saṁvattatī’ti.
analyzed: ayam kho āvuso hetu ayam paccayaḥ yena anuppannaḥ vā dosaḥ uppajjati uppannaḥ vā dosaḥ bhiyyobhāvāya vepullāya savattati iti
translated: This is the reason why, when there is ill-will, it arises and, when arisen, grows and increases.’

original: ‘Ko panāvuso, hetu ko paccayo yena anuppanno vā moho uppajjati uppanno vā moho bhiyyobhāvāya vepullāya saṁvattatī’ti?
analyzed: kaḥ pana āvuso hetu kaḥ paccayaḥ yena anuppannaḥ vā mohaḥ uppajjati uppannaḥ vā mohaḥ bhiyyobhāvāya vepullāya savattati iti
translated: ‘But what is the reason why, when there is delusion, it arises and, when arisen, grows and increases?

original: ‘“Ayoniso manasikāro”tissa vacanīyaṁ.
analyzed: a yonisaḥ manasikāra ūtissa vacanīya
translated: ‘ ‘Improper attention, friend.’

original: Tassa ayoniso manasi karoto anuppanno vā moho uppajjati uppanno vā moho bhiyyobhāvāya vepullāya saṁvattati.
analyzed: tassa ayonisaḥ manasi karotaḥ anuppannaḥ vā mohaḥ uppajjati uppannaḥ vā mohaḥ bhiyyobhāvāya vepullāya savattati
translated: ‘When one attends improperly, delusion arises and, when arisen, grows and increases.

original: Ayaṁ kho, āvuso, hetu ayaṁ paccayo yena anuppanno vā moho uppajjati uppanno vā moho bhiyyobhāvāya vepullāya saṁvattatī’ti.
analyzed: ayam kho āvuso hetu ayam paccayaḥ yena anuppannaḥ vā mohaḥ uppajjati uppannaḥ vā mohaḥ bhiyyobhāvāya vepullāya savattati iti
translated: This is the reason, this is the cause, why ignorance arises and why, once it has arisen, it goes to increase and abundance.’

original: ‘Ko panāvuso, hetu ko paccayo yena anuppanno ceva rāgo nuppajjati uppanno ca rāgo pahīyatī’ti?
analyzed: kaḥ pana āvuso hetu kaḥ paccayaḥ yena anuppannaḥ ca iva rāgaḥ na uppajjati uppannaḥ ca rāgaḥ pahīyati iti
translated: ‘And what, friends, is the reason why lust does not arise in a person and why, if it has arisen, it is abandoned?

original: ‘“Asubhanimittan”tissa vacanīyaṁ.
analyzed: vacanīya
translated: ‘‘The sign of foulness,’ should be the reply.

original: Tassa asubhanimittaṁ yoniso manasi karoto anuppanno ceva rāgo nuppajjati uppanno ca rāgo pahīyati.
