analyzed: tassa asubha nimittam yonisas manasi karotaḥ anuppannaḥ ca iva rāgaḥ na uppajjati uppannaḥ ca rāgaḥ pahīyati
translated: When he brings to mind the sign of foulness, lust does not arise in him and, if it has arisen, it is abandoned.

original: Ayaṁ kho, āvuso, hetu ayaṁ paccayo yena anuppanno ceva rāgo nuppajjati uppanno ca rāgo pahīyatī’ti.
analyzed: ayam kho āvuso hetu ayam paccayaḥ yena anuppannaḥ ca iva rāgaḥ na uppajjati uppannaḥ ca rāgaḥ pahīyati iti
translated: This is the reason why lust does not arise in a person and why, if it has arisen, it is abandoned.’

original: ‘Ko panāvuso, hetu ko paccayo yena anuppanno ceva doso nuppajjati uppanno ca doso pahīyatī’ti?
analyzed: kaḥ pana āvuso hetu kaḥ paccayaḥ yena anuppannaḥ ca iva dosaḥ na uppajjati uppannaḥ ca doso pahīyati iti
translated: ‘And what, friends, is the reason why hatred does not arise in a person and why, if it has arisen, it is abandoned?

original: ‘“Mettā cetovimuttī”tissa vacanīyaṁ.
analyzed: mettā cetaḥ vimutti iti sa vacanīya
translated: ‘‘The liberation of mind by loving-kindness,’ should be the reply.

original: Tassa mettaṁ cetovimuttiṁ yoniso manasi karoto anuppanno ceva doso nuppajjati uppanno ca doso pahīyati.
analyzed: tassa mā ittam cetaḥ vimuttim yonisas manasi karotaḥ anuppannaḥ ca iva doso na uppajjati uppannaḥ ca doso pahīyati
translated: When he brings to mind the liberation of mind by loving-kindness, hatred does not arise in him and, if it has arisen, it is abandoned.

original: Ayaṁ kho, āvuso, hetu ayaṁ paccayo yena anuppanno ceva doso nuppajjati uppanno ca doso pahīyatī’ti.
analyzed: ayam kho āvuso hetu ayam paccayaḥ yena anuppannaḥ ca iva dosaḥ na uppajjati uppannaḥ ca doso pahīyati iti
translated: This is the cause and reason why unarisen ill will doesn’t arise and why arisen ill will is abandoned.”

original: ‘Ko panāvuso, hetu ko paccayo yena anuppanno ceva moho nuppajjati uppanno ca moho pahīyatī’ti?🔽‘“Yonisomanasikāro”tissa vacanīyaṁ.🔽Tassa yoniso manasi karoto anuppanno ceva moho nuppajjati uppanno ca moho pahīyati.
analyzed: kaḥ pana āvuso hetu kaḥ paccayaḥ yena anuppannaḥ ca iva mohaḥ na uppajjati uppannaḥ ca mohaḥ pahīyati iti  vacanīya  tassa yonisas manasi karotaḥ anuppannaḥ ca iva moho na uppajjati uppannaḥ ca moho pahīyati
translated: “And what, friends, is the cause and reason why unarisen delusion doesn’t arise and why arisen delusion is abandoned?

original: Ayaṁ kho, āvuso, hetu ayaṁ paccayo yena anuppanno vā moho nuppajjati uppanno ca moho pahīyatī’”ti.
analyzed: ayam kho āvuso hetu ayam paccayaḥ yena anuppannaḥ vā mohaḥ na uppajjati uppannaḥ ca mohaḥ pahīyati iti
translated: “‘Appropriate attention’: This is the cause and reason why unarisen delusion doesn’t arise and why arisen delusion is abandoned.”

original: Aṭṭhamaṁ.
analyzed: aṭṭhama
translated: The eighth section on “in dependence upon what” is finished.

original: Aṅguttara Nikāya 3.69
analyzed: aṅguttara nikāya
translated: The Book of the Elevens

original: 7. Mahāvagga
analyzed: mahāvagga
translated: The Greater Section

original: Akusalamūlasutta
analyzed: akusala mūla sutta
translated: The Roots of What Is Unhealthy

original: “Tīṇimāni, bhikkhave, akusalamūlāni.
analyzed: tīṇi imāni bhikkhave akusala mūlāni
translated: “Monks, there are these three roots of what is unhealthy.

original: Katamāni tīṇi?🔽Lobho akusalamūlaṁ, doso akusalamūlaṁ, moho akusalamūlaṁ.
analyzed: katamāni tīṇi  lobhaḥ akusala mūla dosaḥ akusala mūla mohaḥ akusala mūla
translated: What three?

original: Yadapi, bhikkhave, lobho tadapi akusalamūlaṁ;
analyzed: yat api bhikkhave lobhaḥ tat api akusala mūla
translated: Greed as a root of what is unhealthy, aversion as a root of what is unhealthy, delusion as a root of what is unhealthy.🔽Greed is a root of what is unhealthy.

original: yadapi luddho abhisaṅkharoti kāyena vācāya manasā tadapi akusalaṁ;
analyzed: yat api luddhaḥ abhisaṅkharoti kāyena vācāya manasā tat api akusala
translated: When one who is greedy formulates a volition–with the body, with speech, or with the mind–that too is unhealthy.

original: yadapi luddho lobhena abhibhūto pariyādinnacitto parassa asatā dukkhaṁ uppādayati
analyzed: yat api luddhaḥ lobhena abhibhūtaḥ pariyādinna citto parassa asatā dukkham uppādayati
translated: When a greedy person, overcome by greed, inflicts suffering upon another under a false pretext,

original: vadhena vā bandhanena vā jāniyā vā garahāya vā pabbājanāya vā balavamhi balattho
analyzed: vadhena vā bandhanena vā jāniyā vā garahāya vā pabbājanāya vā balavamhi balattho
translated: by killing, imprisonment, confiscation, censure, or banishment, thinking: ‘I am powerful, I want power,’

original: itipi tadapi akusalaṁ.
analyzed: itipi tad api a kusala
translated: that too is unwholesome.

original: Itissame lobhajā lobhanidānā lobhasamudayā lobhapaccayā aneke pāpakā akusalā dhammā sambhavanti.
analyzed: iti ssame lobha jāḥ lobha nidānāḥ lobha samudayāḥ lobha paccayāḥ aneke pāpakāḥ akusalāḥ dhammāḥ sambhavanti
translated: Thus, many bad unwholesome qualities originate in greed, have greed as their source, are born from greed, arise from greed.

original: Yadapi, bhikkhave, doso tadapi akusalamūlaṁ;
analyzed: yat api bhikkhave doso tat api akusala mūla
translated: “When there is ill will, that is a root of what is unwholesome.

original: yadapi duṭṭho abhisaṅkharoti kāyena vācāya manasā tadapi akusalaṁ;
analyzed: yat api duṭṭhaḥ abhisaṅkharoti kāyena vācāya manasā tat api akusala
translated: When one who is ill-willed forms an volition by way of body, speech, or mind, that too is unwholesome.

original: yadapi duṭṭho dosena abhibhūto pariyādinnacitto parassa asatā dukkhaṁ uppādayati
analyzed: yat api duṭṭhaḥ dosena abhibhūtaḥ pariyādinna citto parassa asatā dukkham uppādayati
translated: When an ill-willed person, overcome by ill will, inflicts suffering upon another under a false pretext,

original: vadhena vā bandhanena vā jāniyā vā garahāya vā pabbājanāya vā balavamhi balattho
analyzed: vadhena vā bandhanena vā jāniyā vā garahāya vā pabbājanāya vā balavamhi balattho
translated: by killing, imprisonment, confiscation, censure, or banishment, thinking: ‘I am powerful, I want power,’

original: itipi tadapi akusalaṁ.
analyzed: itipi tad api a kusala
translated: that too is unwholesome.

original: Itissame dosajā dosanidānā dosasamudayā dosapaccayā aneke pāpakā akusalā dhammā sambhavanti.
analyzed: iti ssame dosa jāḥ dosa nidānāḥ dosa samudayāḥ dosa paccayāḥ aneke pāpakāḥ akusalāḥ dhammāḥ sambhavanti
translated: Thus, many bad unwholesome qualities originate in ill will, have ill will as their source, are born from ill will, arise from ill will.

original: Yadapi, bhikkhave, moho tadapi akusalamūlaṁ;
analyzed: yat api bhikkhave mohaḥ tat api akusala mūla
translated: Delusion is an unwholesome root.

original: yadapi mūḷho abhisaṅkharoti kāyena vācāya manasā tadapi akusalaṁ;🔽yadapi mūḷho mohena abhibhūto pariyādinnacitto parassa asatā dukkhaṁ uppādayati vadhena
analyzed: yat api mūḍhaḥ abhisaṅkharoti kāyena vācāya manasā tat api akusala  yat api mūḍhaḥ mohena abhibhūtaḥ pariyādinna citto parassa asatā dukkham uppādayati vadhena
translated: When one who is deluded, overcome by delusion, with mind obsessed by it, generates an volition, a volition has arisen that is unwholesome.

original: vā bandhanena vā jāniyā vā garahāya vā pabbājanāya vā balavamhi balattho itipi tadapi akusalaṁ.
analyzed: vā bandhanena vā jāniyā vā garahāya vā pabbājanāya vā balavamhi tad api akusala
translated: When one who is deluded, overcome by delusion, with mind obsessed by it, inflicts suffering upon another under a false pretext—killing, imprisonment, confiscation, censure, or banishment—thinking, ‘I am powerful, I want power,’ that too is unwholesome.

original: Itissame mohajā mohanidānā mohasamudayā mohapaccayā aneke pāpakā akusalā dhammā sambhavanti.🔽Evarūpo cāyaṁ, bhikkhave, puggalo vuccati akālavādītipi, abhūtavādītipi, anatthavādītipi, adhammavādītipi, avinayavādītipi.
analyzed: iti ssame moha jāḥ moha nidānāḥ moha samudayāḥ moha paccayāḥ aneke pāpakāḥ akusalāḥ dhammāḥ sambhavanti  evarūpaḥ ca ayam bhikkhave puggalaḥ vuccati akāla vādī itipi abhūta vādī itipi anattha vādī itipi adhamma vādī itipi avinaya vādī itipi
translated: Thus, from delusion as nutriment, the various kinds of unwholesome states originate.🔽Such a person is called one who speaks at the wrong time, who speaks what is unfactual, who speaks what is unbeneficial, who speaks contrary to the Dhamma, who speaks contrary to the discipline.

original: Kasmā cāyaṁ, bhikkhave, evarūpo puggalo vuccati akālavādītipi, abhūtavādītipi, anatthavādītipi, adhammavādītipi, avinayavādītipi?
analyzed: kasmā ca āya bhikkhave evarūpaḥ puggalaḥ vuccati akāla vādī itipi abhūta vādī itipi anattha vādī itipi adhamma vādī itipi avinaya vādī itipi
translated: And why is such a person called one who speaks at the wrong time … who speaks contrary to the discipline?

original: Tathāhāyaṁ, bhikkhave, puggalo parassa asatā dukkhaṁ uppādayati vadhena vā bandhanena vā jāniyā vā garahāya vā pabbājanāya vā balavamhi balattho itipi.
analyzed: tathā āha bhikkhave puggalaḥ parassa asatā dukkham uppādayati vadhena vā bandhanena vā jāniyā vā garahāya vā pabbājanāya vā balavamhi
translated: “So it is that this person inflicts suffering upon another with the rod and the sword, with oppression, terrorism, and extortion.

original: Bhūtena kho pana vuccamāno avajānāti, no paṭijānāti;
analyzed: bhūtena kho pana vuccamānaḥ avajānāti no paṭijānāti
translated: When spoken to in accordance with fact, he disparages it and does not accept it.

original: abhūtena vuccamāno na ātappaṁ karoti, tassa nibbeṭhanāya itipetaṁ atacchaṁ itipetaṁ abhūtanti.
analyzed: abhūtena vuccamānaḥ na ātappam karoti tassa nibbeṭhanāya itipetam ataccham itipetam abhūtanti
translated: When spoken to contrary to fact, he does not make an effort to clear himself, saying, ‘This is not correct, this is not true.’

original: Tasmā evarūpo puggalo vuccati akālavādītipi, abhūtavādītipi, anatthavādītipi, adhammavādītipi, avinayavādītipi.🔽Evarūpo, bhikkhave, puggalo lobhajehi pāpakehi akusalehi dhammehi abhibhūto pariyādinnacitto diṭṭhe ceva dhamme dukkhaṁ viharati, savighātaṁ saupāyāsaṁ sapariḷāhaṁ.🔽Kāyassa ca bhedā paraṁ maraṇā duggati pāṭikaṅkhā.
analyzed: tasmai evarūpaḥ puggalaḥ vuccati akāla vādī itipi abhūta vādī itipi anattha vādī itipi adhamma vādī itipi avinaya vādī itipi  evarūpaḥ bhikkhave puggalaḥ lobha jehi pāpakehi akusalehi dhammehi abhibhūtaḥ pariyādinna cittaḥ diṭṭhe ca iva dhamme dukkham viharati sa vighātam sa upāyāsam sa pariḷāha  kāyassa ca bhedā param maraṇā duggati pāṭikaṅkhā
translated: Therefore, such a person is called one who speaks at the wrong time, who speaks what is unfactual, who speaks what is unbeneficial, who speaks contrary to the Dhamma and the Discipline.🔽Such a person, overcome by and dwelling in greed, dwells having made greed his basis.🔽Because of bodily action, speech, and thought that are defiled, on the dissolution of the body, after death, he is reborn in a state of misery, in a bad destination, in the nether world, in hell.

original: Dosajehi …pe…
analyzed: dosa jehi pe
translated: “When overcome by and dwelling in hatred, he inflicts suffering upon another with the rod and the sword, with oppression, terrorism, and extortion.🔽“When overcome by and dwelling in delusion,

original: mohajehi pāpakehi akusalehi dhammehi abhibhūto pariyādinnacitto diṭṭhe ceva dhamme dukkhaṁ viharati, savighātaṁ saupāyāsaṁ sapariḷāhaṁ.
analyzed: moha jehi pāpakehi akusalehi dhammehi abhibhūtaḥ pariyādinna cittaḥ diṭṭhe ca iva dhamme dukkham viharati sa vighātam sa upāyāsam sa pariḷāha
translated: and is overwhelmed and oppressed by thoughts born of delusion, he lives in suffering in this very life, with distress, affliction, and fever,🔽

original: Kāyassa ca bhedā paraṁ maraṇā duggati pāṭikaṅkhā.
analyzed: kāyassa ca bhedā param maraṇā duggati pāṭikaṅkhā
translated: He lives in suffering in the present life – irritable, anxious, and distraught – and when the body breaks up, after death, a bad destination can be expected for him.🔽Just as a tree that’s hollowed out at the top,🔽is rotten, and infested with termites,

original: Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, sālo vā dhavo vā phandano vā tīhi māluvālatāhi uddhasto pariyonaddho anayaṁ āpajjati, byasanaṁ āpajjati, anayabyasanaṁ āpajjati;🔽evamevaṁ kho, bhikkhave, evarūpo puggalo lobhajehi pāpakehi akusalehi dhammehi abhibhūto pariyādinnacitto diṭṭhe ceva dhamme dukkhaṁ viharati, savighātaṁ saupāyāsaṁ sapariḷāhaṁ.
analyzed: seyyathā api bhikkhave sālaḥ vā dhavaḥ vā phandanaḥ vā tīhi māluvāla tāhi uddhastaḥ pariyonaddhaḥ anayam āpajjati byasanam āpajjati anaya byasanam āpajjati  evam evam kho bhikkhave evarūpaḥ puggalaḥ lobha jehi pāpakehi akusalehi dhammehi abhibhūtaḥ pariyādinna cittaḥ diṭṭhe ca iva dhamme dukkham viharati sa vighātam sa upāyāsam sa pariḷāha
translated: is bound to fall when touched by the wind,🔽in the same way, a person who’s overcome by bad, unskillful qualities born of greed,

original: Kāyassa ca bhedā paraṁ maraṇā duggati pāṭikaṅkhā.
analyzed: kāyassa ca bhedā param maraṇā duggati pāṭikaṅkhā
translated: lives in suffering in the present life – irritable, anxious, and distraught – and when the body breaks up, after death, a bad destination can be expected for him.

original: Dosajehi …pe…
analyzed: dosa jehi pe
translated: A person who’s overcome by bad, unskillful qualities born of hate …

original: mohajehi pāpakehi akusalehi dhammehi abhibhūto pariyādinnacitto diṭṭhe ceva dhamme dukkhaṁ viharati savighātaṁ saupāyāsaṁ sapariḷāhaṁ.
analyzed: moha jehi pāpakehi akusalehi dhammehi abhibhūtaḥ pariyādinna cittaḥ diṭṭhe ca iva dhamme dukkham viharati sa vighātam sa upāyāsam sa pariḷāha
translated: He lives in suffering in the here and now and meets with calamity and despair.

original: Kāyassa ca bhedā paraṁ maraṇā duggati pāṭikaṅkhā.🔽Imāni kho, bhikkhave, tīṇi akusalamūlānīti.
analyzed: kāyassa ca bhedā param maraṇā duggati pāṭikaṅkhā  imāni kho bhikkhave tīṇi akusala mūlāni iti
translated: And with the breakup of the body, after death, a bad destination can be expected for him.🔽These are the three unwholesome roots.

original: Tīṇimāni, bhikkhave, kusalamūlāni.
analyzed: tīṇi imāni bhikkhave kusala mūlāni
translated: “Bhikkhus, there are these three wholesome roots.

original: Katamāni tīṇi?
analyzed: katamāni tīṇi
translated: What three?

original: Alobho kusalamūlaṁ, adoso kusalamūlaṁ, amoho kusalamūlaṁ.
analyzed: a lobhaḥ kusala mūla a dosaḥ kusala mūla a mohaḥ kusala mūla
translated: Non-greed is a wholesome root; non-hate is a wholesome root; non-delusion is a wholesome root.

original: Yadapi, bhikkhave, alobho tadapi kusalamūlaṁ;
analyzed: yat api bhikkhave alobho tat api kusala mūla
translated: Non-greed, bhikkhus, is a wholesome root;

original: yadapi aluddho abhisaṅkharoti kāyena vācāya manasā tadapi kusalaṁ;
analyzed: yat api a luddhaḥ abhisaṅkharoti kāyena vācāya manasā tat api kusala
translated: whatever is undertaken and pursued by one who is not greedy, whether bodily kamma, verbal kamma, or mental kamma, does not lead to his harm and suffering.

original: yadapi aluddho lobhena anabhibhūto apariyādinnacitto na parassa asatā dukkhaṁ uppādayati
analyzed: yat api a luddhaḥ lobhena an abhibhūtaḥ a pariyādinna cittaḥ na parassa asatā dukkham uppādayati
translated: When one who is not greedy, being ungreedy, does not inflict suffering upon another under a false pretext—

original: vadhena vā bandhanena vā jāniyā vā garahāya vā pabbājanāya vā balavamhi balattho
analyzed: vadhena vā bandhanena vā jāniyā vā garahāya vā pabbājanāya vā balavamhi balattho
translated: by killing, imprisonment, confiscation, censure, or banishment—thinking: ‘I am powerful, I want power,’

original: itipi tadapi kusalaṁ.
analyzed: itipi tad api kusala
translated: that also does not lead to his harm and suffering.

original: Itissame alobhajā alobhanidānā alobhasamudayā alobhapaccayā aneke kusalā dhammā sambhavanti.
analyzed: iti ssame alobha jāḥ alobha nidānāḥ alobha samudayāḥ alobha paccayāḥ aneke kusalāḥ dhammāḥ sambhavanti
translated: So, bhikkhus, from the unwholesome root of greed, unwholesome states come into play, and from them many evil unwholesome states come into play.

original: Yadapi, bhikkhave, adoso tadapi kusalamūlaṁ;
analyzed: yat api bhikkhave adoso tat api kusala mūla
translated: “When there is non-hatred, bhikkhus, that is a wholesome root;

original: yadapi aduṭṭho abhisaṅkharoti kāyena vācāya manasā tadapi kusalaṁ;
analyzed: yat api aduṭṭhaḥ abhisaṅkharoti kāyena vācāya manasā tat api kusala
translated: when one who is free from hatred performs and initiates action by body, speech, and mind, that is wholesome;

original: yadapi aduṭṭho dosena anabhibhūto apariyādinnacitto na parassa asatā dukkhaṁ uppādayati
analyzed: yat api a duṭṭhaḥ dosena an abhibhūtaḥ a pariyādinna cittaḥ na parassa asatā dukkham uppādayati
translated: when one free from hatred, not overcome by hatred, his mind not obsessed by it, does not inflict suffering upon another under a false pretext—

original: vadhena vā bandhanena vā jāniyā vā garahāya vā pabbājanāya vā balavamhi balattho
analyzed: vadhena vā bandhanena vā jāniyā vā garahāya vā pabbājanāya vā balavamhi balattho
translated: by killing, imprisonment, confiscation, censure, or banishment—thinking: ‘I am powerful, I want power,’

original: itipi tadapi kusalaṁ.
analyzed: itipi tad api kusala
translated: that too is wholesome.

original: Itissame adosajā adosanidānā adosasamudayā adosapaccayā aneke kusalā dhammā sambhavanti.
analyzed: iti ssame a dosa jāḥ a dosa nidānāḥ a dosa samudayāḥ a dosa paccayāḥ aneke kusalāḥ dhammāḥ sambhavanti
translated: So, bhikkhus, from the unwholesome root of non-hatred, unwholesome states come into play, and from them many evil unwholesome states come into play.

original: Yadapi, bhikkhave, amoho tadapi kusalamūlaṁ;
analyzed: yat api bhikkhave amohaḥ tat api kusala mūla
translated: “When there is non-delusion, bhikkhus, that is a wholesome root;

original: yadapi amūḷho abhisaṅkharoti kāyena vācāya manasā tadapi kusalaṁ;
analyzed: yat api amūḍhaḥ abhisaṅkharoti kāyena vācāya manasā tat api kusala
translated: when one who is not deluded performs and initiates action by body, speech, and mind, that is wholesome;

original: yadapi amūḷho mohena anabhibhūto apariyādinnacitto na parassa asatā dukkhaṁ uppādayati
analyzed: yat api amūḍhaḥ mohena an abhibhūtaḥ a pariyādinna cittaḥ na parassa asatā dukkham uppādayati
translated: when one not deluded, not overcome by delusion, his mind not obsessed by it, does not inflict suffering upon another under a false pretext—

original: vadhena vā bandhanena vā jāniyā vā garahāya vā pabbājanāya vā balavamhi balattho
analyzed: vadhena vā bandhanena vā jāniyā vā garahāya vā pabbājanāya vā balavamhi balattho
translated: ‘By force, by power, I will make him be executed, imprisoned, fined, or censured.’

original: itipi tadapi kusalaṁ.
analyzed: itipi tad api kusala
translated: This is also skillful.

original: Itissame amohajā amohanidānā amohasamudayā amohapaccayā aneke kusalā dhammā sambhavanti.🔽Evarūpo cāyaṁ, bhikkhave, puggalo vuccati kālavādītipi, bhūtavādītipi, atthavādītipi, dhammavādītipi, vinayavādītipi.
analyzed: iti ssame amoha jāḥ amoha nidānāḥ amoha samudayāḥ amoha paccayāḥ aneke kusalāḥ dhammāḥ sambhavanti  evarūpaḥ ca ayam bhikkhave puggalaḥ vuccati kāla vādī itipi bhūta vādī itipi attha vādī itipi dhamma vādī itipi vinaya vādī itipi
translated: Thus, from non-delusion, many skillful qualities originate.🔽A person of this sort is called a timely speaker, a truth speaker, a meaning speaker, a Dhamma speaker, a discipline speaker.

original: Kasmā cāyaṁ, bhikkhave, evarūpo puggalo vuccati kālavādītipi, bhūtavādītipi, atthavādītipi, dhammavādītipi, vinayavādītipi?
analyzed: kasmā ca āya bhikkhave evarūpaḥ puggalaḥ vuccati kāla vādī itipi bhūta vādī itipi attha vādī itipi dhamma vādī itipi vinaya vādī itipi
translated: And why is a person of this sort called a timely speaker, a truth speaker, a meaning speaker, a Dhamma speaker, a discipline speaker?

original: Tathāhāyaṁ, bhikkhave, puggalo na parassa asatā dukkhaṁ uppādayati vadhena vā bandhanena vā jāniyā vā garahāya vā pabbājanāya vā balavamhi balattho itipi.
analyzed: tathā āha bhikkhave puggalaḥ na parassa asatā dukkham uppādayati vadhena vā bandhanena vā jāniyā vā garahāya vā pabbājanāya vā balavamhi
translated: Because this person does not, by force, by power, make another suffer—by having him executed, imprisoned, fined, censured, or exiled.

original: Bhūtena kho pana vuccamāno paṭijānāti no avajānāti;
analyzed: bhūtena kho pana vuccamānaḥ paṭijānāti no avajānāti
translated: When told, ‘You’ve done this or that,’ he admits it, he doesn’t deny it.

original: abhūtena vuccamāno ātappaṁ karoti tassa nibbeṭhanāya:
analyzed: abhūtena vuccamānaḥ ātappam karoti tassa nibbeṭhanāya
translated: When told, ‘You haven’t done this or that,’ he makes an effort to clear himself:

original: ‘itipetaṁ atacchaṁ, itipetaṁ abhūtan’ti.
analyzed: iti petam atacchaḥ iti petam abhūtanti
translated: ‘This is not true, this is not fact.’

original: Tasmā evarūpo puggalo vuccati kālavādītipi, atthavādītipi, dhammavādītipi, vinayavādītipi.
analyzed: tasmai evarūpaḥ puggalaḥ vuccati kāla vādī itipi attha vādī itipi dhamma vādī itipi vinaya vādī itipi
translated: That’s why such a person is called one who speaks at the right time, who speaks what is factual, true, beneficial, and correct.🔽For such a person, unwholesome qualities born of greed are abandoned, cut off at the root, made like a palm stump, obliterated, and unable to arise in the future.

original: Evarūpassa, bhikkhave, puggalassa lobhajā pāpakā akusalā dhammā pahīnā ucchinnamūlā tālāvatthukatā anabhāvaṅkatā āyatiṁ anuppādadhammā.🔽Diṭṭheva dhamme sukhaṁ viharati avighātaṁ anupāyāsaṁ apariḷāhaṁ.
analyzed: evarūpassa bhikkhave puggalassa lobha jāḥ pāpakāḥ akusalāḥ dhammāḥ pahīnāḥ ucchinna mūlā tālāvatthukatā anabhāvaṅkatā āyatim an uppāda dhammā  diṭṭhā iva dhamme sukham viharati avighātam an upāyāsam a pariḷāha
translated: They live happily in the present life, free from enmity, affliction, and suffering.

original: Diṭṭheva dhamme parinibbāyati.
analyzed: diṭṭhe iva dhamme parinibbāyati
translated: They attain nibbana in the present life.

original: Dosajā …pe…
analyzed: dosa jā pe
translated: For such a person, unwholesome qualities born of aversion …🔽… are obliterated, and unable to arise in the future.🔽They live happily in the present life, free from enmity, affliction, and suffering.

original: parinibbāyati.
analyzed: parinibbāyati
translated: They attain nibbana in the present life.

original: Mohajā …pe…
analyzed: moha jā pe
translated: For such a person, unwholesome qualities born of delusion …🔽… are obliterated, and unable to arise in the future.🔽They live happily in the present life, free from enmity, affliction, and suffering.

original: parinibbāyati.
analyzed: parinibbāyati
translated: They attain nibbana in the present life.

original: Seyyathāpi bhikkhave, sālo vā dhavo vā phandano vā tīhi māluvālatāhi uddhasto pariyonaddho.
analyzed: seyyathā api bhikkhave sālaḥ vā dhavaḥ vā phandanaḥ vā tīhi māluvā latāhi uddhastaḥ pariyonaddhaḥ
translated: Suppose there were a shala tree, a dhaja tree, or a karu tree choked by three maluva creepers.

original: Atha puriso āgaccheyya kudālapiṭakaṁ ādāya.
analyzed: atha purisaḥ āgaccheyya kudāla piṭakam ādāya
translated: Then a person came along with a spade and a basket.

original: So taṁ māluvālataṁ mūle chindeyya, mūle chetvā palikhaṇeyya, palikhaṇitvā mūlāni uddhareyya, antamaso usīranāḷimattānipi.
analyzed: saḥ tam māluvālatam mūle chindeyya mūle chetvā palikhaṇeyya palikhaṇitvā mūlāni uddhareyya antamasaḥ usīra nāḷi mattāni pi
translated: He would cut down the creepers at the root, dig them up, and pull out the roots, even the fine rootlets and root fragments.

original: So taṁ māluvālataṁ khaṇḍākhaṇḍikaṁ chindeyya, khaṇḍākhaṇḍikaṁ chetvā phāleyya, phāletvā🔽sakalikaṁ sakalikaṁ kareyya, sakalikaṁ sakalikaṁ karitvā vātātape visoseyya, vātātape🔽visosetvā agginā ḍaheyya, agginā ḍahitvā masiṁ kareyya, masiṁ karitvā mahāvāte vā
analyzed: saḥ tam māluvālatam khaṇḍākhaṇḍikam chindeyya khaṇḍākhaṇḍikam chetvā phāleyya phāletvā  sa kalikam sa kalikam kareyya sa kalikam sa kalikam karitvā vāta ātape visoseyya vāta ātape  visosetvā agginā ḍaheyya agginā ḍahitvā masim kareyya masim karitvā mahāvāte vā
translated: He would cut that vine into pieces, chop it up into pieces,🔽and reduce it to fragments.🔽He would dry it in the wind and sun, burn it in a fire,

original: ophuṇeyya nadiyā vā sīghasotāya pavāheyya.
analyzed: ophuṇeyya nadiyā vā sīgha sotāya pavāheyya
translated: reduce it to ashes, and then wipe out the ashes with his hand or have someone else do so.

original: Evamassa tā, bhikkhave, māluvālatā ucchinnamūlā tālāvatthukatā anabhāvaṅkatā āyatiṁ anuppādadhammā.
analyzed: evam assa tā bhikkhave māluvāla tā ucchinna mūlā tālāvatthuka tā anabhāvaṅka tā āyatim an uppāda dhammā
translated: So that vine would be cut off at the root, made like a palm stump, obliterated so that it is no more subject to future arising.

original: Evamevaṁ kho, bhikkhave, evarūpassa puggalassa lobhajā pāpakā akusalā dhammā pahīnā ucchinnamūlā tālāvatthukatā anabhāvaṅkatā āyatiṁ anuppādadhammā.
analyzed: evam evam kho bhikkhave evarūpassa puggalassa lobha jāḥ pāpakāḥ akusalāḥ dhammāḥ pahīnāḥ ucchinna mūlā tālāvatthukatā anabhāvaṅkatā āyatim an uppāda dhammā
translated: So too, bhikkhus, in the case of a person of such a nature, evil unwholesome states born of greed are abandoned, cut off at the root, made like a palm stump, obliterated so that they are no more subject to future arising.

original: Diṭṭheva dhamme sukhaṁ viharati avighātaṁ anupāyāsaṁ apariḷāhaṁ.
analyzed: diṭṭhā iva dhamme sukham viharati avighātam an upāyāsam a pariḷāha
translated: He dwells in this very life free from distress, vexation, and despair,

original: Diṭṭheva dhamme parinibbāyati.
analyzed: diṭṭhe iva dhamme parinibbāyati
translated: and he attains nibbana in this very life.

original: Dosajā …pe…
analyzed: dosa jā pe
translated: “In the case of a person of such a nature, evil unwholesome states born of hatred are abandoned…🔽“In the case of a person of such a nature, evil unwholesome states born of delusion are abandoned…

original: mohajā pāpakā akusalā dhammā pahīnā ucchinnamūlā tālāvatthukatā anabhāvaṅkatā āyatiṁ anuppādadhammā.
analyzed: moha jā pāpakā akusalā dhammā pahīnā ucchinna mūlā tālāvatthukatā anabhāvaṅkatā āyatim an uppāda dhammā
translated: Bad unwholesome thoughts born of delusion have been abandoned by me. They’ve been cut off at the root, made like a palm stump, obliterated so that they’re unable to arise in the future.🔽I live in the present life free of greed, free of hatred, free of delusion, free of affliction, free of bondage, free of barriers, free of barriers, free of fetters, free of bonds, and I live very comfortably.

original: Diṭṭheva dhamme sukhaṁ viharati avighātaṁ anupāyāsaṁ apariḷāhaṁ.🔽Diṭṭheva dhamme parinibbāyati.
analyzed: diṭṭhā iva dhamme sukham viharati avighātam an upāyāsam a pariḷāha  diṭṭhe iva dhamme parinibbāyati
translated: I live in the present life having reached the consummation and perfection of direct knowledge.🔽These are the three wholesome roots.”

original: Imāni kho, bhikkhave, tīṇi kusalamūlānī”ti.
analyzed: imāni kho bhikkhave tīṇi kusala mūlāni iti
translated: The ninth section on the three.

original: Navamaṁ.🔽Aṅguttara Nikāya 3.70
analyzed: navama  aṅguttara nikāya
translated: The Book of the Elevens

original: 7. Mahāvagga
analyzed: mahāvagga
translated: The Greater Division

original: Uposathasutta
analyzed: uposatha sutta
translated: The Uposatha

original: Evaṁ me sutaṁ—
analyzed: evam me suta
translated: Thus have I heard.

original: ekaṁ samayaṁ bhagavā sāvatthiyaṁ viharati pubbārāme migāramātupāsāde.
analyzed: ekam samayam bhagavā sāvatthiyam viharati pubbārāme migāra mātu pāsāde
translated: On one occasion the Blessed One was dwelling at Savatthi in the Eastern Park in Migara’s mother’s mansion.

original: Atha kho visākhā migāramātā tadahuposathe yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā
analyzed: atha khalu visākhā migāra mātā tadah uposathe yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā
translated: Then Visakha, Migara’s mother, approached the Blessed One,

original: bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi. Ekamantaṁ nisinnaṁ kho visākhaṁ migāramātaraṁ bhagavā etadavoca:
analyzed: bhagavantam abhivādetvā ekamantam nisīdi ekamantam nisinnam kho visākham migāra mātaram bhagavān etat avoca
translated: paid homage to him, sat down to one side, and the Blessed One said to her:

original: “handa kuto nu tvaṁ, visākhe, āgacchasi divā divassā”ti?
analyzed: handa kutas nu tva visākhe āgacchasi divā divassāti
translated: “Visakha, where are you coming from in the middle of the day?”

original: “Uposathāhaṁ, bhante, ajja upavasāmī”ti.
analyzed: uposathā āha bhante ajje upavasāmi iti
translated: “Today, venerable sir, I am observing the uposatha.”

original: “Tayo khome, visākhe, uposathā.
analyzed: tayoḥ khome visākhe uposathā
translated: “There are these three observances, Visakha.

original: Katame tayo?
analyzed: katame tayaḥ
translated: What are the three?

original: Gopālakuposatho, nigaṇṭhuposatho, ariyuposatho.
analyzed: gopālaku posathaḥ nigaṇṭhu posathaḥ ariyu posathaḥ
translated: The observance of cattle, the observance of the monastics, and the noble observance.

original: Kathañca, visākhe, gopālakuposatho hoti?
analyzed: kathañca visākhe gopāla kuposathaḥ hoti
translated: And what is the observance of cattle?

original: Seyyathāpi, visākhe, gopālako sāyanhasamaye sāmikānaṁ gāvo niyyātetvā iti paṭisañcikkhati:
analyzed: seyyathā api visākhe gopālakaḥ sāyanha samaye sāmikānam gāvaḥ iti paṭisañcikkhati
translated: Just as a cowherd, in the evening, would count his cattle and check whether any are missing or not,

original: ‘ajja kho gāvo amukasmiñca amukasmiñca padese cariṁsu, amukasmiñca amukasmiñca padese pānīyāni piviṁsu;
analyzed: ajja kho gāvaḥ amukasmin ca amukasmin ca padese amukasmin ca amukasmin ca padese pānīyāni pivisu
translated: thinking: ‘Today my cattle wandered here and there, they drank water here and there,

original: sve dāni gāvo amukasmiñca amukasmiñca padese carissanti, amukasmiñca amukasmiñca padese pānīyāni pivissantī’ti;
analyzed: sve dāni gāvaḥ amukasmin ca amukasmin ca padese carissanti amukasmin ca amukasmin ca padese pānīyāni pivissanti iti
translated: tomorrow they will wander here and there, they will drink water here and there,’

original: evamevaṁ kho, visākhe, idhekacco uposathiko iti paṭisañcikkhati:
analyzed: evam evam kho visākhe idha ekaccaḥ uposathikaḥ iti paṭisañcikkhati
translated: in the same way, Visakha, some observer of the observance thinks:

original: ‘ahaṁ khvajja idañcidañca khādanīyaṁ khādiṁ, idañcidañca bhojanīyaṁ bhuñjiṁ;
analyzed: aham khvajjaḥ idam ca idam ca khādanīyam khādi idam ca idam ca bhojanīyam bhuñji
translated: ‘Today I ate this and that, I ate as much as I wanted,

original: sve dānāhaṁ idañcidañca khādanīyaṁ khādissāmi, idañcidañca bhojanīyaṁ bhuñjissāmī’ti.
analyzed: sve dānā aham idam ca idam ca khādanīyam khādissāmi idam ca idam ca bhojanīyam bhuñjissāmi iti
translated: tomorrow I will eat this and that, I will eat as much as I want.’

original: So tena abhijjhāsahagatena cetasā divasaṁ atināmeti.
analyzed: saḥ tena abhijjhā sahagatena cetasā divasam atināmeti
translated: He spends the day with a mind obsessed by thoughts of sensual desire.

original: Evaṁ kho, visākhe, gopālakuposatho hoti.
analyzed: evam khalu visākhe gopāla kuposathaḥ hoti
translated: That, Visākhā, is how the cowherds observe the uposatha.

original: Evaṁ upavuttho kho, visākhe, gopālakuposatho na mahapphalo hoti na mahānisaṁso na mahājutiko na mahāvipphāro.
analyzed: evam upavutthaḥ kho visākhe gopālaka uposathaḥ na mahapphalaḥ hoti na mahā nisasaḥ na mahā jutiko na mahā vipphāro
translated: But when the uposatha is observed like this, it is of no great fruit or great profit or great splendor or great scope.

original: Kathañca, visākhe, nigaṇṭhuposatho hoti?
analyzed: kathañca visākhe nigaṇṭha uposathaḥ hoti
translated: “And how, Visākhā, does the Nigaṇṭha observe the uposatha?

original: Atthi, visākhe, nigaṇṭhā nāma samaṇajātikā.
analyzed: atthi visākhe nigaṇṭhā nāma samaṇa jātikā
translated: There are, Visākhā, the Nigaṇṭhas, who are of the ascetic practice of nakedness, who use no restraint, who lick their hands, who do not come when asked, who do not go when asked.

original: Te sāvakaṁ evaṁ samādapenti:
analyzed: te sāvakam evam samādapenti
translated: They exhort a pupil thus:

original: ‘ehi tvaṁ, ambho purisa, ye puratthimāya disāya pāṇā paraṁ yojanasataṁ tesu daṇḍaṁ nikkhipāhi;🔽ye pacchimāya disāya pāṇā paraṁ yojanasataṁ tesu daṇḍaṁ nikkhipāhi;
analyzed: ehi tva ambho purisa ye puratthimāya disāya pāṇā param yojana satam tesu daṇḍam nikkhipāhi  ye pacchimāya disāya pāṇā param yojana satam tesu daṇḍam nikkhipāhi
translated: ‘Come, good man, lay aside the stick for living beings and take up the stick for living beings.🔽Lay aside the sword for living beings and take up the sword for living beings.

original: ye uttarāya disāya pāṇā paraṁ yojanasataṁ tesu daṇḍaṁ nikkhipāhi;
analyzed: ye uttarāya disāya pāṇā param yojana satam tesu daṇḍam nikkhipāhi
translated: Lay aside the rod for living beings and take up the rod for living beings.

original: ye dakkhiṇāya disāya pāṇā paraṁ yojanasataṁ tesu daṇḍaṁ nikkhipāhī’ti.
analyzed: ye dakkhiṇāya disāya pāṇā param yojana satam tesu daṇḍam nikkhipāhi iti
translated: Lay aside the violence for living beings and take up the violence for living beings.’

original: Iti ekaccānaṁ pāṇānaṁ anuddayāya anukampāya samādapenti, ekaccānaṁ pāṇānaṁ nānuddayāya nānukampāya samādapenti.
analyzed: iti ekaccānam pāṇānam anuddayāya anukampāya samādapenti ekaccānam pāṇānam na anuddayāya na anukampāya samādapenti
translated: So they encourage some beings with sympathy and compassion, and some they don’t.

original: Te tadahuposathe sāvakaṁ evaṁ samādapenti:
analyzed: te sāvakam evam samādapenti
translated: On the observance day they encourage their disciples, saying,

original: ‘ehi tvaṁ, ambho purisa, sabbacelāni nikkhipitvā evaṁ vadehi—
analyzed: ehi tva ambho purisa sabba celāni nikkhipitvā evam vadehi
translated: ‘Come, good man, put aside all your clothes, and say this:

original: nāhaṁ kvacani kassaci kiñcanatasmiṁ, na ca mama kvacani katthaci kiñcanatatthī’ti.
analyzed: na aham kvacani kassaci kiñcana tasmi na ca mama kvacani katthaci kiñcana tatthi iti
translated: “I don’t belong to anyone anywhere, and no one belongs to me anywhere.”’

original: Jānanti kho panassa mātāpitaro:
analyzed: jānanti kho panassa mātā pitaraḥ
translated: But his parents know,

original: ‘ayaṁ amhākaṁ putto’ti;
analyzed: ayam amhākam putto ti
translated: ‘This is our child.’

original: sopi jānāti:
analyzed: saḥ upi jānāti
translated: And he knows,

original: ‘ime mayhaṁ mātāpitaro’ti.
analyzed: ime mayham mātā pitaraḥ uti
translated: ‘These are my parents.’

original: Jānāti kho panassa puttadāro:
analyzed: jānāti kho panassa putta dāro
translated: His wife and children know,

original: ‘ayaṁ mayhaṁ bhattā’ti;
analyzed: ayam mayham bhattā ati
translated: ‘This is our husband and father.’

original: sopi jānāti:
analyzed: saḥ upi jānāti
translated: And he knows,

original: ‘ayaṁ mayhaṁ puttadāro’ti.
analyzed: ayam mayham putta dāro ti
translated: ‘These are my wife and children.’

original: Jānanti kho panassa dāsakammakaraporisā:
analyzed: jānanti kho panassa dāsa kammakara porisā
translated: His slaves, servants, and workers know,

original: ‘ayaṁ amhākaṁ ayyo’ti;
analyzed: ayam amhākam
translated: ‘This is our master.’

original: sopi jānāti:
analyzed: saḥ upi jānāti
translated: And he knows,

original: ‘ime mayhaṁ dāsakammakaraporisā’ti.
analyzed: ime mayham dāsa kammakara porisā ti
translated: ‘These are my slaves, servants, and workers.’

original: Iti yasmiṁ samaye sacce samādapetabbā musāvāde tasmiṁ samaye samādapenti.
analyzed: iti yasmin samaye sacce samādapetabbāḥ musāvāde tasmin samaye samādapenti
translated: So they encourage with truth when they should encourage with a lie.

original: Idaṁ tassa musāvādasmiṁ vadāmi.
analyzed: idam tassa musāvādasmin vadāmi
translated: I say this is his lying.

original: So tassā rattiyā accayena bhoge adinnaṁyeva paribhuñjati.
analyzed: saḥ tassā rattiyā accayena bhoge a dinnayā iva paribhuñjati
translated: When the night has passed, he uses what has not been given to him.

original: Idaṁ tassa adinnādānasmiṁ vadāmi.
analyzed: idam tassa a dinna ādānasmin vadāmi
translated: I say this is his stealing.

original: Evaṁ kho, visākhe, nigaṇṭhuposatho hoti.
analyzed: evam kho visākhe nigaṇṭha uposathaḥ hoti
translated: This, Visākhā, is how the Niganthas observe the uposatha.

original: Evaṁ upavuttho kho, visākhe, nigaṇṭhuposatho na mahapphalo hoti na mahānisaṁso na mahājutiko na mahāvipphāro.
analyzed: evam upavutthaḥ kho visākhe nigaṇṭha uposathaḥ na mahapphalaḥ hoti na mahā nisasaḥ na mahā jutikaḥ na mahā vipphāraḥ
translated: When the uposatha is observed like this, it is of great fruit and benefit, luminous and pervasive, but it does not lead to any specific destination.

original: Kathañca, visākhe, ariyuposatho hoti?
analyzed: kathañca visākhe ariya uposathaḥ hoti
translated: And how, Visākhā, does one observe the noble uposatha?

original: Upakkiliṭṭhassa, visākhe, cittassa upakkamena pariyodapanā hoti.
analyzed: upakkiliṭṭhassa visākhe cittassa upakkamena pariyodapanā hoti
translated: For a defiled mind, Visākhā, purification comes about through striving.

original: Kathañca, visākhe, upakkiliṭṭhassa cittassa upakkamena pariyodapanā hoti?
analyzed: kathañca visākhe upakkiliṭṭhassa cittassa upakkamena pariyodapanā hoti
translated: And how, Visākhā, does purification come about through striving for a defiled mind?

original: Idha, visākhe, ariyasāvako tathāgataṁ anussarati:
analyzed: idha visākhe ariya sāvako tathāgatam anussarati
translated: Here, Visākhā, a noble disciple recollects the Tathāgata thus:

original: ‘itipi so bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho vijjācaraṇasampanno sugato lokavidū anuttaro purisadammasārathi satthā devamanussānaṁ buddho bhagavā’ti.
analyzed: iti pi saḥ bhagavā araham sammāsambuddhaḥ vijjā caraṇa sampanno sugataḥ loka vidū anuttaraḥ purisa damma sārathi satthā deva manussānam buddhaḥ bhagavā ati
translated: ‘The Blessed One is an arahant, perfectly enlightened, accomplished in true knowledge and conduct, fortunate, knower of the world, unsurpassed trainer of persons to be tamed, teacher of gods and humans, the Enlightened One, the Blessed One.’

original: Tassa tathāgataṁ anussarato cittaṁ pasīdati, pāmojjaṁ uppajjati, ye cittassa upakkilesā te pahīyanti, seyyathāpi, visākhe, upakkiliṭṭhassa sīsassa upakkamena pariyodapanā hoti.
analyzed: tassa tathāgatam anussarataḥ cittam pasīdati pāmojjam uppajjati ye cittassa upakkilesā te pahīyanti seyyathā api visākhe upakkiliṭṭhassa sīsassa upakkamena pariyodapanā hoti
translated: As he does so his mind becomes clear, joy arises, defilements are abandoned, and his mind becomes calm. Just as a dirty piece of glass that is put on ashes is cleaned by rubbing it with ashes,

original: Kathañca, visākhe, upakkiliṭṭhassa sīsassa upakkamena pariyodapanā hoti?🔽Kakkañca paṭicca mattikañca paṭicca udakañca paṭicca purisassa ca tajjaṁ vāyāmaṁ paṭicca, evaṁ kho, visākhe, upakkiliṭṭhassa sīsassa upakkamena pariyodapanā hoti.
analyzed: kathañca visākhe upakkiliṭṭhassa sīsassa upakkamena pariyodapanā hoti  kakkam ca paṭicca mattikam ca paṭicca udakam ca paṭicca purisassa ca tajjam vāyāmam paṭicca evam kho visākhe upakkiliṭṭhassa sīsassa upakkamena pariyodapanā hoti
translated: and when it has been cleaned and polished, it becomes clear;

original: Evamevaṁ kho, visākhe, upakkiliṭṭhassa cittassa upakkamena pariyodapanā hoti.
analyzed: evam evam kho visākhe upakkiliṭṭhassa cittassa upakkamena pariyodapanā hoti
translated: so too, when the mind is dirty, it is cleaned by developing the recollection of the Tathagata.

original: Kathañca, visākhe, upakkiliṭṭhassa cittassa upakkamena pariyodapanā hoti?
analyzed: kathañca visākhe upakkiliṭṭhassa cittassa upakkamena pariyodapanā hoti
translated: “And how, Visakha, is the mind purified by the recollection of the Tathagata?

original: Idha, visākhe, ariyasāvako tathāgataṁ anussarati:
analyzed: idha visākhe ariya sāvako tathāgatam anussarati
translated: Here, Visakha, a noble disciple recollects the Tathagata thus:

original: ‘itipi so bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho vijjācaraṇasampanno sugato lokavidū anuttaro purisadammasārathi satthā devamanussānaṁ buddho bhagavā’ti.
analyzed: iti pi saḥ bhagavā araham sammāsambuddhaḥ vijjā caraṇa sampanno sugataḥ loka vidū anuttaraḥ purisa damma sārathi satthā deva manussānam buddhaḥ bhagavā ati
translated: ‘The Blessed Lord is an Arahant, a fully-enlightened Buddha, endowed with wisdom and conduct, the Well-Farer, Knower of the worlds, incomparable Trainer of men to be tamed, Teacher of gods and humans, enlightened and blessed.’

original: Tassa tathāgataṁ anussarato cittaṁ pasīdati, pāmojjaṁ uppajjati, ye cittassa upakkilesā te pahīyanti.
analyzed: tassa tathāgatam anussarato cittam pasīdati pāmojjam uppajjati ye cittassa upakkilesā te pahīyanti
translated: As he does so his mind becomes clear, and the corruptions of the mind are abandoned.

original: Ayaṁ vuccati, visākhe:
analyzed: ayam vuccati visākhe
translated: This, Visakha, is called

original: ‘ariyasāvako brahmuposathaṁ upavasati, brahmunā saddhiṁ saṁvasati, brahmañcassa ārabbha cittaṁ pasīdati, pāmojjaṁ uppajjati, ye cittassa upakkilesā te pahīyanti’.
analyzed: ariya sāvakaḥ brahmuposatham upavasati brahmunā saddhim savasati brahman ca ssa ārabbha cittam pasīdati pāmojjam uppajjati ye cittassa upakkilesā te pahīyanti
translated: ‘a noble disciple who observes the Uposatha of the Holy Ones, who associates with the Holy Ones, who has the Holy Ones as his chosen people, and whose mind is purified in the Dispensation of the Holy Ones.’

original: Evaṁ kho, visākhe, upakkiliṭṭhassa cittassa upakkamena pariyodapanā hoti..1🔽Upakkiliṭṭhassa, visākhe, cittassa upakkamena pariyodapanā hoti.
analyzed: evam kho visākhe upakkiliṭṭhassa cittassa upakkamena pariyodapanā hoti  upakkiliṭṭhassa visākhe cittassa upakkamena pariyodapanā hoti
translated: This is how the mind is purified by means of the approach.

original: Kathañca, visākhe, upakkiliṭṭhassa cittassa upakkamena pariyodapanā hoti?
analyzed: kathañca visākhe upakkiliṭṭhassa cittassa upakkamena pariyodapanā hoti
translated: “And how, Visakha, is the mind purified by means of the breakthrough?

original: Idha, visākhe, ariyasāvako dhammaṁ anussarati:
analyzed: idha visākhe ariya sāvakaḥ dhammaṃ anussarati
translated: Here, Visakha, a noble disciple recollects the Dhamma thus:

original: ‘svākkhāto bhagavatā dhammo sandiṭṭhiko akāliko ehipassiko opaneyyiko paccattaṁ veditabbo viññūhī’ti.
analyzed: su ākkhātaḥ bhagavatā dhammaḥ sandiṭṭhikaḥ akālikaḥ ehipassikaḥ opaneyyikaḥ paccattam veditabbaḥ viññūhi iti
translated: ‘The Dhamma is well-expounded by the Lord, to be seen here and now, timeless, inviting inspection, leading onward, to be experienced individually by the wise.’

original: Tassa dhammaṁ anussarato cittaṁ pasīdati, pāmojjaṁ uppajjati, ye cittassa upakkilesā te pahīyanti, seyyathāpi, visākhe, upakkiliṭṭhassa kāyassa upakkamena pariyodapanā hoti.
analyzed: tassa dhammam anussarataḥ cittam pasīdati pāmojjam uppajjati ye cittassa upakkilesā te pahīyanti seyyathā api visākhe upakkiliṭṭhassa kāyassa upakkamena pariyodapanā hoti
translated: As he recollects the Dhamma, his mind becomes serene, and the corruptions of the mind are abandoned. Just as a cloth that is soiled and stained becomes clean and bright,

original: Kathañca, visākhe, upakkiliṭṭhassa kāyassa upakkamena pariyodapanā hoti?
analyzed: kathañca visākhe upakkiliṭṭhassa kāyassa upakkamena pariyodapanā hoti
translated: How does a soiled cloth become clean and bright?

original: Sottiñca paṭicca, cuṇṇañca paṭicca, udakañca paṭicca, purisassa ca tajjaṁ vāyāmaṁ paṭicca.
analyzed: sottiñca paṭicca cuṇṇam ca paṭicca udakam ca paṭicca purisassa ca tajjam vāyāmam paṭicca
translated: Because of soap, water and rubbing.

original: Evaṁ kho, visākhe, upakkiliṭṭhassa kāyassa upakkamena pariyodapanā hoti.
analyzed: evam kho visākhe upakkiliṭṭhassa kāyassa upakkamena pariyodapanā hoti
translated: So it is with a soiled cloth.

original: Evamevaṁ kho, visākhe, upakkiliṭṭhassa cittassa upakkamena pariyodapanā hoti.
analyzed: evam evam kho visākhe upakkiliṭṭhassa cittassa upakkamena pariyodapanā hoti
translated: So it is, Visakha, with a soiled mind.

original: Kathañca, visākhe, upakkiliṭṭhassa cittassa upakkamena pariyodapanā hoti?
analyzed: kathañca visākhe upakkiliṭṭhassa cittassa upakkamena pariyodapanā hoti
translated: How does a soiled mind become clean?

original: Idha, visākhe, ariyasāvako dhammaṁ anussarati:
analyzed: idha visākhe ariya sāvakaḥ dhammaṃ anussarati
translated: Here, Visakha, a noble disciple recollects the Dhamma thus:

original: ‘svākkhāto bhagavatā dhammo sandiṭṭhiko akāliko ehipassiko opaneyyiko paccattaṁ veditabbo viññūhī’ti.
analyzed: su ākkhātaḥ bhagavatā dhammaḥ sandiṭṭhikaḥ akālikaḥ ehipassikaḥ opaneyyikaḥ paccattam veditabbaḥ viññūhi iti
translated: ‘The Dhamma is well proclaimed by the Blessed One, visible here and now, immediately effective, inviting inspection, onward leading, to be experienced by the wise for themselves.’

original: Tassa dhammaṁ anussarato cittaṁ pasīdati, pāmojjaṁ uppajjati, ye cittassa upakkilesā te pahīyanti.
analyzed: tassa dhammaṃ anussarato cittam pasīdati pāmojjam uppajjati ye cittassa upakkilesā te pahīyanti
translated: As he recollects the Dhamma, his mind becomes placid, and the corruptions of the mind are abandoned.

original: Ayaṁ vuccati, visākhe, ‘ariyasāvako dhammuposathaṁ upavasati, dhammena saddhiṁ saṁvasati,
analyzed: ayam vuccati visākhe ariya sāvakaḥ dhamma uposatham upavasati dhammena saddhim
translated: This is called a noble disciple who observes the uposatha endowed with the Dhamma, who observes the uposatha fulfilled with the Dhamma.

original: dhammañcassa ārabbha cittaṁ pasīdati, pāmojjaṁ uppajjati, ye cittassa upakkilesā te pahīyanti’.
analyzed: dhammam ca assa ārabbha cittam pasīdati pāmojjam uppajjati ye cittassa upakkilesā te pahīyanti
translated: Endowed with this Dhamma, he enters upon the bliss of renunciation, the bliss of seclusion, the bliss of peace, the bliss of enlightenment.

original: Evaṁ kho, visākhe, upakkiliṭṭhassa cittassa upakkamena pariyodapanā hoti..2🔽Upakkiliṭṭhassa, visākhe, cittassa upakkamena pariyodapanā hoti.
analyzed: evam kho visākhe upakkiliṭṭhassa cittassa upakkamena pariyodapanā hoti  upakkiliṭṭhassa visākhe cittassa upakkamena pariyodapanā hoti
translated: “Thus, Visakha, there is the purification by searching of a mind that is defiled.

original: Kathañca, visākhe, upakkiliṭṭhassa cittassa upakkamena pariyodapanā hoti?
analyzed: kathañca visākhe upakkiliṭṭhassa cittassa upakkamena pariyodapanā hoti
translated: “And how, Visakha, is there the purification by searching of a mind that is defiled?

original: Idha, visākhe, ariyasāvako saṅghaṁ anussarati:
analyzed: idha visākhe ariya sāvakaḥ saṅghaṃ anussarati
translated: Here, Visakha, a noble disciple recollects the Sangha thus:

original: ‘suppaṭipanno bhagavato sāvakasaṅgho, ujuppaṭipanno bhagavato sāvakasaṅgho, ñāyappaṭipanno🔽bhagavato sāvakasaṅgho, sāmīcippaṭipanno bhagavato sāvakasaṅgho, yadidaṁ cattāri🔽purisayugāni aṭṭha purisapuggalā esa bhagavato sāvakasaṅgho āhuneyyo pāhuneyyo dakkhiṇeyyo
analyzed: suppaṭipannaḥ bhagavataḥ sāvaka saṅghaḥ uju ppaṭipannaḥ bhagavataḥ sāvaka saṅghaḥ ñāya ppaṭipannaḥ  bhagavato sāvaka saṅgho sāmīcippaṭipannaḥ bhagavato sāvaka saṅghaḥ yat idam cattāri  purisa yugāni aṭṭha purisa puggalā esa bhagavato sāvaka saṅghaḥ āhuneyyaḥ pāhuneyyaḥ dakkhiṇeyyaḥ
translated: ‘The Sangha of the Buddha’s disciples is practising the good way …

original: añjalikaraṇīyo anuttaraṁ puññakkhettaṁ lokassā’ti.
analyzed: añjali karaṇīyaḥ anuttaram puñña kkhettam lokassa ati
translated: the unsurpassed field of merit for the world.’

original: Tassa saṅghaṁ anussarato cittaṁ pasīdati, pāmojjaṁ uppajjati, ye cittassa upakkilesā te pahīyanti, seyyathāpi, visākhe, upakkiliṭṭhassa vatthassa upakkamena pariyodapanā hoti.🔽Kathañca, visākhe, upakkiliṭṭhassa vatthassa upakkamena pariyodapanā hoti?
analyzed: tassa saṅgham anussarataḥ cittam pasīdati pāmojjam uppajjati ye cittassa upakkilesā te pahīyanti seyyathā api visākhe upakkiliṭṭhassa vatthassa upakkamena pariyodapanā hoti  kathañca visākhe upakkiliṭṭhassa vatthassa upakkamena pariyodapanā hoti
translated: As he recollects the Sangha, his mind becomes placid, and so on as before.

original: Usmañca paṭicca, khārañca paṭicca, gomayañca paṭicca, udakañca paṭicca, purisassa ca tajjaṁ vāyāmaṁ paṭicca.
analyzed: usmañca paṭicca khārañca paṭicca gomayañca paṭicca udakañca paṭicca purisassa ca tajjam vāyāmam paṭicca
translated: And how is a soiled cloth cleansed by means of water and a cloth?🔽It is cleansed by means of water and a cloth when water is applied and the cloth is rubbed.

original: Evaṁ kho, visākhe, upakkiliṭṭhassa vatthassa upakkamena pariyodapanā hoti.
analyzed: evam kho visākhe upakkiliṭṭhassa vatthassa upakkamena pariyodapanā hoti
translated: That’s how to wash a dirty cloth by working on it.

original: Evamevaṁ kho, visākhe, upakkiliṭṭhassa cittassa upakkamena pariyodapanā hoti.
analyzed: evam evam kho visākhe upakkiliṭṭhassa cittassa upakkamena pariyodapanā hoti
translated: In the same way, there’s the purification by working on the mind for one whose mind is dirty.

original: Kathañca, visākhe, upakkiliṭṭhassa cittassa upakkamena pariyodapanā hoti?
analyzed: kathañca visākhe upakkiliṭṭhassa cittassa upakkamena pariyodapanā hoti
translated: And how is there the purification by working on the mind for one whose mind is dirty?

original: Idha, visākhe, ariyasāvako saṅghaṁ anussarati:
analyzed: idha visākhe ariya sāvakaḥ saṅghaṃ anussarati
translated: It’s when a noble disciple recollects the Saṅgha:

original: ‘suppaṭipanno bhagavato sāvakasaṅgho …pe… anuttaraṁ puññakkhettaṁ lokassā’ti.
analyzed: suppaṭipannaḥ bhagavato sāvaka saṅghaḥ pe anuttaram puññakkhettam lokassa ati
translated: ‘The Saṅgha of the Buddha’s disciples is practicing the way … the unsurpassed field of merit for the world.’

original: Tassa saṅghaṁ anussarato cittaṁ pasīdati, pāmojjaṁ uppajjati, ye cittassa upakkilesā te pahīyanti.
analyzed: tassa saṅgham anussarato cittam pasīdati pāmojjam uppajjati ye cittassa upakkilesā te pahīyanti
translated: As they recollect the Saṅgha, their mind becomes clear, joy arises, and the defilements of the mind are given up.

original: Ayaṁ vuccati, visākhe, ‘ariyasāvako saṅghuposathaṁ upavasati, saṅghena saddhiṁ saṁvasati,
analyzed: ayam vuccati visākhe ariya sāvakaḥ saṅgha uposatham upavasati saṅghena saddhim savasati
translated: This is called a noble disciple who observes the observance day together with the Saṅgha, who lives together with the Saṅgha,

original: saṅghañcassa ārabbha cittaṁ pasīdati, pāmojjaṁ uppajjati, ye cittassa upakkilesā te pahīyanti’.
analyzed: saṅghañcassa ārabbha cittam pasīdati pāmojjam uppajjati ye cittassa upakkilesā te pahīyanti
translated: and whose mind becomes clear, joy arises, and the defilements of the mind are given up in dependence on the Saṅgha.

original: Evaṁ kho, visākhe, upakkiliṭṭhassa cittassa upakkamena pariyodapanā hoti..3🔽Upakkiliṭṭhassa, visākhe, cittassa upakkamena pariyodapanā hoti.
analyzed: evam kho visākhe upakkiliṭṭhassa cittassa upakkamena pariyodapanā hoti  upakkiliṭṭhassa visākhe cittassa upakkamena pariyodapanā hoti
translated: This is how the mind that is defiled is purified by the process of abandoning.

original: Kathañca, visākhe, upakkiliṭṭhassa cittassa upakkamena pariyodapanā hoti?
analyzed: kathañca visākhe upakkiliṭṭhassa cittassa upakkamena pariyodapanā hoti
translated: “And how, Visakha, is the mind that is defiled purified by the process of abandoning?

original: Idha, visākhe, ariyasāvako attano sīlāni anussarati akhaṇḍāni acchiddāni asabalāni akammāsāni bhujissāni viññuppasatthāni aparāmaṭṭhāni samādhisaṁvattanikāni.
analyzed: idha visākhe ariya sāvakaḥ attanaḥ sīlāni anussarati akhaṇḍāni acchiddāni a sabalāni a kammāsāni bhujissāni viññu pasatthāni a parāmaṭṭhāni samādhi savattanikāni
translated: Here, Visakha, a noble disciple recollects the Dhamma thus: ‘The Dhamma is well proclaimed by the Blessed One, visible here and now, immediately effective, inviting inspection, onward leading, to be experienced by the wise for themselves.’

original: Tassa sīlaṁ anussarato cittaṁ pasīdati, pāmojjaṁ uppajjati, ye cittassa upakkilesā te pahīyanti, seyyathāpi, visākhe, upakkiliṭṭhassa ādāsassa upakkamena pariyodapanā hoti.
analyzed: tassa sīlam anussarataḥ cittam pasīdati pāmojjam uppajjati ye cittassa upakkilesā te pahīyanti seyyathā api visākhe upakkiliṭṭhassa ādāsassa upakkamena pariyodapanā hoti
translated: As he recollects the Dhamma, his mind becomes placid, joy arises, defilements are abandoned, and his mind becomes purified. Just as a cloth that is defiled and stained becomes pure and bright through the process of washing, so too, the mind that is defiled becomes purified by the process of abandoning.

original: Kathañca, visākhe, upakkiliṭṭhassa ādāsassa upakkamena pariyodapanā hoti?
analyzed: kathañca visākhe upakkiliṭṭhassa ādāsassa upakkamena pariyodapanā hoti
translated: “And how, Visakha, is the mind that is defiled purified by the process of abandoning?

original: Telañca paṭicca, chārikañca paṭicca, vālaṇḍupakañca paṭicca, purisassa ca tajjaṁ vāyāmaṁ paṭicca.🔽Evaṁ kho, visākhe, upakkiliṭṭhassa ādāsassa upakkamena pariyodapanā hoti.
analyzed: telam ca paṭicca chārikam ca paṭicca vālaṇḍupakam ca paṭicca purisassa ca tajjam vāyāmam paṭicca  evam kho visākhe upakkiliṭṭhassa ādāsassa upakkamena pariyodapanā hoti
translated: and oil, and ashes, and a pad of cotton wool, and a man’s appropriate effort.

original: Evamevaṁ kho, visākhe, upakkiliṭṭhassa cittassa upakkamena pariyodapanā hoti.
analyzed: evam evam kho visākhe upakkiliṭṭhassa cittassa upakkamena pariyodapanā hoti
translated: “So too, Visakha, the purification of a defiled consciousness is through the means of effort.

original: Kathañca, visākhe, upakkiliṭṭhassa cittassa upakkamena pariyodapanā hoti?
analyzed: kathañca visākhe upakkiliṭṭhassa cittassa upakkamena pariyodapanā hoti
translated: “And how, Visakha, is the purification of a defiled consciousness through the means of effort?

original: Idha, visākhe, ariyasāvako attano sīlāni anussarati akhaṇḍāni …pe… samādhisaṁvattanikāni.
analyzed: idha visākhe ariya sāvako attano sīlāni anussarati akhaṇḍāni pe samādhi savattanikāni
translated: “Here, Visakha, a noble disciple recollects the Dhamma thus: ‘The Dhamma is well proclaimed by the Blessed One, visible here and now, immediately effective, inviting inspection, onward leading, to be experienced by the wise for themselves.’

original: Tassa sīlaṁ anussarato cittaṁ pasīdati, pāmojjaṁ uppajjati, ye cittassa upakkilesā te pahīyanti.
analyzed: tassa sīlam anussarato cittam pasīdati pāmojjam uppajjati ye cittassa upakkilesā te pahīyanti
translated: As he recollects the Dhamma his mind becomes placid, and the corruptions of the mind are abandoned.

original: Ayaṁ vuccati, visākhe, ‘ariyasāvako sīluposathaṁ upavasati, sīlena saddhiṁ saṁvasati, sīlañcassa ārabbha cittaṁ pasīdati, pāmojjaṁ uppajjati, ye cittassa upakkilesā te pahīyanti’.
analyzed: ayam vuccati visākhe ariya sāvako sīla uposatham upavasati sīlena saddhim savasati sīlam ca ssa ārabbha cittam pasīdati pāmojjam uppajjati ye cittassa upakkilesā te pahīyanti
translated: This is called a noble disciple who observes the uposatha of the Dhamma, who associates with the Dhamma, who is united with the Dhamma, who has taken refuge in the Dhamma.🔽“Again, Visakha, a noble disciple recollects the Sangha thus:

original: Evaṁ kho, visākhe, upakkiliṭṭhassa cittassa upakkamena pariyodapanā hoti..4
analyzed: evam kho visākhe upakkiliṭṭhassa cittassa upakkamena pariyodapanā hoti
translated: This is how the mind that is subject to cankers is purified by degrees.

original: Upakkiliṭṭhassa, visākhe, cittassa upakkamena pariyodapanā hoti.
analyzed: upakkiliṭṭhassa visākhe cittassa upakkamena pariyodapanā hoti
translated: “The mind that is subject to cankers is purified by degrees.

original: Kathañca, visākhe, upakkiliṭṭhassa cittassa upakkamena pariyodapanā hoti?
analyzed: kathañca visākhe upakkiliṭṭhassa cittassa upakkamena pariyodapanā hoti
translated: And how is the mind that is subject to cankers purified by degrees?

original: Idha, visākhe, ariyasāvako devatā anussarati:
analyzed: idha visākhe ariya sāvakaḥ devatāḥ anussarati
translated: “Here, Visakha, a noble disciple recollects the gods thus:

original: ‘santi devā cātumahārājikā, santi devā tāvatiṁsā, santi devā yāmā, santi devā tusitā,🔽santi devā nimmānaratino, santi devā paranimmitavasavattino, santi devā brahmakāyikā,🔽santi devā tatuttari.
analyzed: santi devā cātumahārājikā santi devā santi devā santi devā  santi devā nimmāna ratinaḥ santi devā paranimmitavasavattinaḥ santi devā brahmakāyikā  santi devā tatuttari
translated: ‘There are the gods of the heaven of the Four Great Kings,

original: Yathārūpāya saddhāya samannāgatā tā devatā ito cutā tatthupapannā, mayhampi tathārūpā saddhā saṁvijjati.
analyzed: yathārūpāya saddhāya samannāgatā tāḥ devatāḥ itas cutā mayham pi tathārūpā saddhā savijjati
translated: the gods of the heaven of the Thirty-three, the Yama gods, the gods of the Tusita heaven, the gods who delight in creating, the gods who wield power over others’ creations, and the gods in the Brahma-world.🔽These gods arise from a still higher state.🔽Those gods possess faith, virtue, renunciation, wisdom, and energy,

original: Yathārūpena sīlena samannāgatā tā devatā ito cutā tatthupapannā, mayhampi tathārūpaṁ sīlaṁ saṁvijjati.
analyzed: yathārūpena sīlena samannāgatā tāḥ devatāḥ itas cutā mayham pi tathārūpam sīlam savijjati
translated: and I too possess these things.

original: Yathārūpena sutena samannāgatā tā devatā ito cutā tatthupapannā, mayhampi tathārūpaṁ sutaṁ saṁvijjati.🔽Yathārūpena cāgena samannāgatā tā devatā ito cutā tatthupapannā, mayhampi tathārūpo cāgo saṁvijjati.
analyzed: yathārūpena sutena samannāgatā tāḥ devatāḥ itas cutā mayham pi tathārūpam sutam savijjati  yathārūpena cāgena samannāgatā tāḥ devatāḥ itas cutā mayham pi tathārūpaḥ cāgo savijjati
translated: ‘The faith, virtue, learning, generosity, and wisdom of those deities who have passed away there from after enjoying divine glory and happiness were just like mine.

original: Yathārūpāya paññāya samannāgatā tā devatā ito cutā tatthupapannā, mayhampi tathārūpā paññā saṁvijjatī’ti.
analyzed: yathārūpāya paññāya samannāgatā tāḥ devatāḥ itas cutā tattha upapannā mayham pi tathārūpā paññā savijjati iti
translated: I have the same faith, virtue, learning, generosity, and wisdom as those deities who have passed away there from after enjoying divine glory and happiness.’

original: Tassa attano ca tāsañca devatānaṁ saddhañca sīlañca sutañca cāgañca paññañca anussarato
analyzed: tassa attano ca tāsañca devatānam saddham ca sīlam ca sutam ca cāgam ca paññam ca anussarato
translated: As he recollects his own faith, virtue, learning, generosity, and wisdom, and the faith, virtue, learning, generosity, and wisdom of those deities,

original: cittaṁ pasīdati, pāmojjaṁ uppajjati, ye cittassa upakkilesā te pahīyanti, seyyathāpi,🔽visākhe, upakkiliṭṭhassa jātarūpassa upakkamena pariyodapanā hoti.
analyzed: cittam pasīdati pāmojjam uppajjati ye cittassa upakkilesā te pahīyanti seyyathā api  visākhe upakkiliṭṭhassa jātarūpassa upakkamena pariyodapanā hoti
translated: his mind becomes placid, and so does his body. His defilements are diminished.🔽Just as a cloth that is dirty is made clean by washing it,

original: Kathañca, visākhe, upakkiliṭṭhassa jātarūpassa upakkamena pariyodapanā hoti?
analyzed: kathañca visākhe upakkiliṭṭhassa jātarūpassa upakkamena pariyodapanā hoti
translated: and how is a dirty cloth made clean by washing it?

original: Ukkañca paṭicca, loṇañca paṭicca, gerukañca paṭicca, nāḷikasaṇḍāsañca paṭicca, purisassa ca tajjaṁ vāyāmaṁ paṭicca.🔽Evaṁ kho, visākhe, upakkiliṭṭhassa jātarūpassa upakkamena pariyodapanā hoti.
analyzed: ukkam ca paṭicca loṇam ca paṭicca gerukam ca paṭicca nāḷika saṇḍāsam ca paṭicca purisassa ca tajjam vāyāmam paṭicca  evam kho visākhe upakkiliṭṭhassa jātarūpassa upakkamena pariyodapanā hoti
translated: This is how the purification of gold is effected by means of the five purifiers and the work of the smith.

original: Evamevaṁ kho, visākhe, upakkiliṭṭhassa cittassa upakkamena pariyodapanā hoti.
analyzed: evam evam kho visākhe upakkiliṭṭhassa cittassa upakkamena pariyodapanā hoti
translated: So too, Visakha, the purification of the defiled mind is effected by means of the five purifications and the work of the one who has undertaken them.

original: Kathañca, visākhe, upakkiliṭṭhassa cittassa upakkamena pariyodapanā hoti?
analyzed: kathañca visākhe upakkiliṭṭhassa cittassa upakkamena pariyodapanā hoti
translated: And how is the purification of the defiled mind effected by means of the five purifications and the work of the one who has undertaken them?

original: Idha, visākhe, ariyasāvako devatā anussarati:
analyzed: idha visākhe ariya sāvakaḥ devatāḥ anussarati
translated: Here, Visakha, a noble disciple recollects the faith, the virtue, the learning, the generosity, and the understanding that are developed in himself thus:

original: ‘santi devā cātumahārājikā, santi devā tāvatiṁsā …pe… santi devā tatuttari.🔽Yathārūpāya saddhāya samannāgatā tā devatā ito cutā tatthupapannā, mayhampi tathārūpā saddhā saṁvijjati.🔽Yathārūpena sīlena …🔽sutena …
analyzed: santi devā santi devā santi devā santi devā  yathārūpāya saddhāya samannāgatā tāḥ devatāḥ itas cutā mayham pi tathārūpā saddhā savijjati  yathārūpena sīlena  sutena
translated: ‘I have faith, virtue, learning, generosity, and understanding that are developed in myself.’

original: cāgena …
analyzed: cāgena
translated: When a noble disciple recollects his own faith, virtue, learning, generosity, and understanding, on that occasion his mind is not obsessed by lust, hatred, or delusion; on that occasion his mind is simply straight.

original: paññāya samannāgatā tā devatā ito cutā tatthupapannā, mayhampi tathārūpā paññā saṁvijjatī’ti.
analyzed: paññāya samannāgatā tāḥ devatāḥ itas cutā tattha upapannā mayham pi tathārūpā paññā savijjati iti
translated: ‘Those deities who have faith, virtue, learning, generosity, and wisdom, and who have passed away from here and been reborn there, I too have those same qualities.’

original: Tassa attano ca tāsañca devatānaṁ saddhañca sīlañca sutañca cāgañca paññañca anussarato cittaṁ pasīdati, pāmojjaṁ uppajjati, ye cittassa upakkilesā te pahīyanti.
analyzed: tassa attano ca tāsañca devatānam saddhañca sīlañca sutañca cāgañca paññañca anussarato cittam pasīdati pāmojjam uppajjati ye cittassa upakkilesā te pahīyanti
translated: As he recollects his own faith, virtue, learning, generosity, and wisdom, and the faith, virtue, learning, generosity, and wisdom of those deities, his mind becomes placid, and so on as in §103 up to he makes much of himself.

original: Ayaṁ vuccati, visākhe, ‘ariyasāvako devatuposathaṁ upavasati, devatāhi saddhiṁ saṁvasati, devatā ārabbha cittaṁ pasīdati, pāmojjaṁ uppajjati, ye cittassa upakkilesā te pahīyanti’.
analyzed: ayam vuccati visākhe ariya sāvakaḥ devatuposatham upavasati devatāhi saddhim sa vasati devatāḥ ārabbha cittam pasīdati pāmojjam uppajjati ye cittassa upakkilesā te pahīyanti
translated: This, Visakha, is called a noble disciple who observes the Uposatha of the deities, who dwells together with the deities, who has the deities as his friends, who has the deities as his companions, who has the deities as his refuge.

original: Evaṁ kho, visākhe, upakkiliṭṭhassa cittassa upakkamena pariyodapanā hoti..5
analyzed: evam kho visākhe upakkiliṭṭhassa cittassa upakkamena pariyodapanā hoti
translated: This is how the mind that is defiled becomes clear.

original: Sa kho so, visākhe, ariyasāvako iti paṭisañcikkhati:
analyzed: sa kho saḥ visākhe ariya sāvakaḥ iti paṭisañcikkhati
translated: “The noble disciple considers thus:

original: ‘yāvajīvaṁ arahanto pāṇātipātaṁ pahāya pāṇātipātā paṭiviratā nihitadaṇḍā nihitasatthā lajjī dayāpannā sabbapāṇabhūtahitānukampī viharanti;
analyzed: yāvajīvam arahantaḥ pāṇa atipātam pahāya pāṇa atipātā paṭiviratāḥ nihita daṇḍāḥ nihita satthāḥ lajjī dayā āpannā sabba pāṇa bhūta hita anukampī viharanti
translated: ‘For as long as they live, the Worthy Ones give up killing living creatures, refrain from killing living creatures, they give up sticks and swords and are conscientious and merciful and live full of compassion for all living beings.

original: ahampajja imañca rattiṁ imañca divasaṁ pāṇātipātaṁ pahāya pāṇātipātā paṭivirato nihitadaṇḍo nihitasattho lajjī dayāpanno sabbapāṇabhūtahitānukampī viharāmi.
analyzed: aham pajje imañca rattim imañca divasam pāṇa atipātam pahāya pāṇa atipātā paṭivirataḥ nihita daṇḍaḥ nihita satthaḥ lajjī dayā āpannaḥ sabba pāṇa bhūta hita anukampī viharāmi
translated: Today, for this day and night, I too will give up killing living creatures, refrain from killing living creatures, I will give up sticks and swords and will be conscientious and merciful and will live full of compassion for all living beings.

original: Imināpi aṅgena arahataṁ anukaromi, uposatho ca me upavuttho bhavissati.
analyzed: iminā api aṅgena arahatam anukaromi uposathaḥ ca me upavutthaḥ bhavissati
translated: In this respect I will imitate the Worthy Ones, and so my Uposatha will be observed.

original: Yāvajīvaṁ arahanto adinnādānaṁ pahāya adinnādānā paṭiviratā dinnādāyī dinnapāṭikaṅkhī, athenena sucibhūtena attanā viharanti;
analyzed: yāvajīvam arahantaḥ a dinna ādānam pahāya a dinna ādānā paṭiviratāḥ dinna ādāyī dinna pāṭikaṅkhī athenena sucibhūtena attanā viharanti
translated: For as long as they live, the Worthy Ones give up taking what has not been given, refrain from taking what has not been given, they take what has been given, expect what has been given, they are honest and declare themselves to be honest, and live in purity with regard to accepting gifts.

original: ahampajja imañca rattiṁ imañca divasaṁ adinnādānaṁ pahāya adinnādānā paṭivirato dinnādāyī dinnapāṭikaṅkhī, athenena sucibhūtena attanā viharāmi.
analyzed: aham pajje imañca rattim imañca divasam a dinna ādānam pahāya a dinna ādānā paṭivirataḥ dinna ādāyī dinna pāṭikaṅkhī atha enena suci bhūtena attanā viharāmi
translated: Today, for this day and night, I too will give up taking what has not been given, refrain from taking what has not been given, I will take what has been given, expect what has been given, I will be honest and declare myself to be honest, and will live in purity with regard to accepting gifts.

original: Imināpi aṅgena arahataṁ anukaromi, uposatho ca me upavuttho bhavissati.
analyzed: iminā api aṅgena arahatam anukaromi uposathaḥ ca me upavutthaḥ bhavissati
translated: I too follow the arahants in this respect.

original: Yāvajīvaṁ arahanto abrahmacariyaṁ pahāya brahmacārī ārācārī viratā methunā gāmadhammā;🔽ahampajja imañca rattiṁ imañca divasaṁ abrahmacariyaṁ pahāya brahmacārī ārācārī virato methunā gāmadhammā.
analyzed: yāvajīvam arahantaḥ a brahmacariyam pahāya brahmacārī ārācārī viratāḥ methunāḥ gāmadhammā  ahampajje imañca rattim imañca divasam a brahmacariyam pahāya brahmacārī ārācārī virataḥ methunā gāmadhammā
translated: For as long as they live, the arahants abandon and abstain from sexual intercourse, rejecting sensual desire, living without possessions, celibate, abstaining from sexual intercourse.🔽For today only, for this night and day, I too will abandon and abstain from sexual intercourse, rejecting sensual desire, living without possessions, celibate, abstaining from sexual intercourse.

original: Imināpi aṅgena arahataṁ anukaromi, uposatho ca me upavuttho bhavissati.
analyzed: iminā api aṅgena arahatam anukaromi uposathaḥ ca me upavutthaḥ bhavissati
translated: I too follow the arahants in this respect.

original: Yāvajīvaṁ arahanto musāvādaṁ pahāya musāvādā paṭiviratā saccavādī saccasandhā thetā paccayikā avisaṁvādakā lokassa;
analyzed: yāvajīvam arahantaḥ musāvādam pahāya musāvādā paṭiviratā sacca vādī sacca sandhā thetā paccayikā a visavādakā lokassa
translated: For as long as they live, the arahants abandon and abstain from telling lies, rejecting lying, truthful, trustworthy, reliable, sincere, not deceitful in their speech.

original: ahampajja imañca rattiṁ imañca divasaṁ musāvādaṁ pahāya musāvādā paṭivirato saccavādī saccasandho theto paccayiko avisaṁvādako lokassa.
analyzed: ahampajje imañca rattim imañca divasam musāvādam pahāya musāvādā paṭivirataḥ sacca vādī sacca sandho theto paccayikaḥ a visavādakaḥ lokassa
translated: For today only, for this night and day, I too will abandon and abstain from telling lies, rejecting lying, truthful, trustworthy, reliable, sincere, not deceitful in my speech.

original: Imināpi aṅgena arahataṁ anukaromi, uposatho ca me upavuttho bhavissati.
analyzed: iminā api aṅgena arahatam anukaromi uposathaḥ ca me upavutthaḥ bhavissati
translated: I too follow the arahants in this respect.

original: Yāvajīvaṁ arahanto surāmerayamajjapamādaṭṭhānaṁ pahāya surāmerayamajjapamādaṭṭhānā paṭiviratā;
analyzed: yāvajīvam arahanto surā meraya majja pamāda ṭṭhānam pahāya surā meraya majja pamāda ṭṭhānā paṭiviratā
translated: As long as they live, the Worthy Ones abandon and abstain from drinking alcohol, liquor, and strong drink, which cause heedlessness.

original: ahampajja imañca rattiṁ imañca divasaṁ surāmerayamajjapamādaṭṭhānaṁ pahāya surāmerayamajjapamādaṭṭhānā paṭivirato.
analyzed: aham pajje imañca rattim imañca divasam surā meraya majja pamāda ṭṭhānam pahāya surā meraya majja pamāda ṭṭhānā paṭivirataḥ
translated: For today and this night I too shall abandon and abstain from drinking alcohol, liquor, and strong drink, which cause heedlessness.

original: Imināpi aṅgena arahataṁ anukaromi, uposatho ca me upavuttho bhavissati.
analyzed: iminā api aṅgena arahatam anukaromi uposathaḥ ca me upavutthaḥ bhavissati
translated: In this respect I emulate the Worthy Ones, and so my Uposatha will be observed.

original: Yāvajīvaṁ arahanto ekabhattikā rattūparatā viratā vikālabhojanā;
analyzed: yāvajīvam arahantaḥ eka bhattikāḥ rattu uparatāḥ viratāḥ vikāla bhojanā
translated: As long as they live, the Worthy Ones eat in one part of the day, abstaining from food at night and from eating at the wrong time.

original: ahampajja imañca rattiṁ imañca divasaṁ ekabhattiko rattūparato virato vikālabhojanā.
analyzed: ahampajje iman ca rattim iman ca divasam ekabhattikaḥ rattu uparataḥ virataḥ vikāla bhojanā
translated: For today and this night I too shall eat in one part of the day, abstaining from food at night and from eating at the wrong time.

original: Imināpi aṅgena arahataṁ anukaromi, uposatho ca me upavuttho bhavissati.
analyzed: iminā api aṅgena arahatam anukaromi uposathaḥ ca me upavutthaḥ bhavissati
translated: In this respect I emulate the Worthy Ones, and so my Uposatha will be observed.

original: Yāvajīvaṁ arahanto naccagītavāditavisūkadassanamālāgandhavilepanadhāraṇamaṇḍanavibhūsanaṭṭhānā paṭiviratā;
analyzed: yāvajīvam arahantaḥ nacca gīta vādita visūka dassana mālā gandha vilepana dhāraṇa maṇḍana vibhūsana ṭṭhānā paṭiviratā
translated: As long as they live, the Worthy Ones abandon and abstain from dancing, singing, instrumental music, going to see entertainments, wearing garments, adorning themselves with garlands, scents, and unguents, and from behaving in a manner contrary to the Dhamma.

original: ahampajja imañca rattiṁ imañca divasaṁ naccagītavāditavisūkadassanamālāgandhavilepanadhāraṇamaṇḍanavibhūsanaṭṭhānā paṭivirato.
analyzed: ahampajje imañca rattim imañca divasam nacca gīta vādita visūka dassana mālā gandha vilepana dhāraṇa maṇḍana vibhūsana ṭhānā paṭivirataḥ
translated: Today, for this night and day, I too will refrain from dancing, singing, playing music, and watching shows; from wearing garlands, beautifying myself with scents, and embellishing myself with cosmetics; and from using high or luxurious beds and seats.

original: Imināpi aṅgena arahataṁ anukaromi, uposatho ca me upavuttho bhavissati.
analyzed: iminā api aṅgena arahatam anukaromi uposathaḥ ca me upavutthaḥ bhavissati
translated: In this way I too will follow the perfected ones’ practice and observe the uposatha.

original: Yāvajīvaṁ arahanto uccāsayanamahāsayanaṁ pahāya uccāsayanamahāsayanā paṭiviratā nīcaseyyaṁ kappenti mañcake vā tiṇasanthārake vā;
analyzed: yāvajīvam arahantaḥ uccāsayana mahāsayanam pahāya uccāsayana mahāsayanā paṭiviratāḥ nīca seyyam kappenti mañcake vā tiṇa santhārake vā
translated: ‘For as long as they live, the perfected ones abandon and abstain from high and luxurious beds and seats; they lie down on a low bed or a grass mat.

original: ahampajja imañca rattiṁ imañca divasaṁ uccāsayanamahāsayanaṁ pahāya uccāsayanamahāsayanā paṭivirato nīcaseyyaṁ kappemi mañcake vā tiṇasanthārake vā.
analyzed: aham pajje imañca rattim imañca divasam uccāsayana mahāsayanam pahāya uccāsayana mahāsayanā paṭivirataḥ nīca seyyam kappemi mañcake vā tiṇa santhārake vā
translated: Today, for this night and day, I too will abandon and abstain from high and luxurious beds and seats; I will lie down on a low bed or a grass mat.

original: Imināpi aṅgena arahataṁ anukaromi, uposatho ca me upavuttho bhavissatī’ti.
analyzed: iminā api aṅgena arahatam anukaromi uposathaḥ ca me upavutthaḥ bhavissati iti
translated: In this way I too will follow the perfected ones’ practice and observe the uposatha.’

original: Evaṁ kho, visākhe, ariyuposatho hoti.
analyzed: evam kho visākhe ariya uposathaḥ hoti
translated: This is how the spiritual observance is observed.

original: Evaṁ upavuttho kho, visākhe, ariyuposatho mahapphalo hoti mahānisaṁso mahājutiko mahāvipphāro.
analyzed: evam upavutthaḥ kho visākhe ariya uposathaḥ mahapphalaḥ hoti mahā nisasaḥ mahā jutikaḥ mahā vipphāro
translated: When observed like this, the spiritual observance is very fruitful and beneficial, very radiant, very auspicious.”

original: Kīvamahapphalo hoti kīvamahānisaṁso kīvamahājutiko kīvamahāvipphāro?
analyzed: kīva mahapphalaḥ hoti kīva mahā nisasaḥ kīva mahā jutiko kīva mahā vipphāro
translated: How much more fruitful and beneficial it is, how much more splendid and bountiful!

original: Seyyathāpi, visākhe, yo imesaṁ soḷasannaṁ mahājanapadānaṁ pahūtarattaratanānaṁ issariyādhipaccaṁ rajjaṁ kāreyya, seyyathidaṁ—
analyzed: sā iyyathā api visākhe yaḥ imesam mahā janapadānam pahūta ratta rata nānam issariya adhipaccam rajjam kāreyya tā iyyathā idam
translated: Suppose, Visakha, one were to rule over these sixteen great countries abounding in the seven treasures, that is to say:

original: aṅgānaṁ, magadhānaṁ, kāsīnaṁ, kosalānaṁ, vajjīnaṁ, mallānaṁ, cetīnaṁ, vaṅgānaṁ, kurūnaṁ,
analyzed: aṅgāna magadhāna kāsīna kosalāna vajjīna mallāna cetīna vaṅgāna kurūna
translated: the Angas, the Magadhas, the Kasis, the Kosalans, the Vajjis, the Mallas, the Cetīs, the Vacchas, the Kurus,

original: pañcālānaṁ, macchānaṁ, sūrasenānaṁ, assakānaṁ, avantīnaṁ, gandhārānaṁ, kambojānaṁ,
analyzed: pañcālāna macchāna sūrasenāna assakāna avantīna gandhārāna kambojāna
translated: the Pancalas, the Macchas, the Surasenas, the Assakas, the Avantis, the Gandharas, and the Kambojas.

original: aṭṭhaṅgasamannāgatassa uposathassa etaṁ kalaṁ nāgghati soḷasiṁ.
analyzed: aṭṭhaṅga samannāgatassa uposathassa etam kalam soḷasi
translated: This does not amount to a sixteenth part of the Uposatha observance complete with its eight factors.

original: Taṁ kissa hetu?🔽Kapaṇaṁ, visākhe, mānusakaṁ rajjaṁ dibbaṁ sukhaṁ upanidhāya.
analyzed: tam kim sa hetu  kapaṇa visākhe mānusakam rajjam dibbam sukham upanidhāya
translated: Why is that?🔽Because human sovereignty, Visakha, is trifling when compared with heavenly bliss.

original: Yāni, visākhe, mānusakāni paññāsa vassāni, cātumahārājikānaṁ devānaṁ eso eko rattindivo.
analyzed: yāni visākhe mānusakāni paññāsa vassāni cātumahārājikānam devānam esaḥ ekaḥ rattindivaḥ
translated: Fifty human years, Visakha, make one day and night for the devas of the Four Great Kings.

original: Tāya rattiyā tiṁsarattiyo māso.
analyzed: tāya rattiyā tisa rattiyaḥ māsaḥ
translated: Thirty of these days make up their month.

original: Tena māsena dvādasamāsiyo saṁvaccharo.
analyzed: tena māsena dvādasa māsiyaḥ savat śaraḥ
translated: Twelve of these months make up their year.

original: Tena saṁvaccharena dibbāni pañca vassasatāni cātumahārājikānaṁ devānaṁ āyuppamāṇaṁ.🔽Ṭhānaṁ kho panetaṁ, visākhe, vijjati yaṁ idhekacco itthī vā puriso vā aṭṭhaṅgasamannāgataṁ
analyzed: tena savaccharena dibbāni pañca vassa satāni cātumahārājikānam devānam āyu ppamāṇa  ṭhānam kho pana ita visākhe vijjati yam idha ekaccaḥ itthī vā purisaḥ vā aṭṭhaṅga samannāgata
translated: With that calculation, the lifespan of the gods of the Four Great Kings is five hundred divine years.

original: uposathaṁ upavasitvā kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā cātumahārājikānaṁ devānaṁ sahabyataṁ upapajjeyya.
analyzed: uposatham upavasitvā kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā cātumahārājikānam devānam sahabyatam upapajjeyya
translated: It’s possible that a woman or man who observes the Uposatha complete with its eight factors, at the break-up of the body, after death, may be reborn in companionship with the gods of the Four Great Kings.

original: Idaṁ kho panetaṁ, visākhe, sandhāya bhāsitaṁ:
analyzed: idam khalu paneta visākhe sandhāya bhāsita
translated: This is what I said, and in reference to this is it said.🔽‘Human kingship is worth one-sixteenth

original: ‘kapaṇaṁ mānusakaṁ rajjaṁ dibbaṁ sukhaṁ upanidhāya’.
analyzed: kapaṇam mānusakam rajjam dibbam sukham upanidhāya
translated: of the bliss of the gods of the Tavatimsa heaven.’

original: Yaṁ, visākhe, mānusakaṁ vassasataṁ, tāvatiṁsānaṁ devānaṁ eso eko rattindivo.
analyzed: ya visākhe mānusakam tāvatisānam devānam esaḥ ekaḥ rattindivaḥ
translated: What is a hundred human years is one day and night for the gods of the Tavatimsa heaven.

original: Tāya rattiyā tiṁsarattiyo māso.
analyzed: tāya rattiyā tisa rattiyaḥ māsaḥ
translated: Thirty of these days make a month.

analyzed: tena māsena dvādasa māsiyaḥ savat śaraḥ
translated: Twelve of these months make a year.

analyzed: tena savaccharena dibbam vassa sahassam tāvatisānam devānam āyu ppamāṇa
translated: With that calculation, the lifespan of the gods of the Tavatimsa heaven is one thousand divine years.

analyzed: ṭhānam kho pana ita visākhe vijjati yam idha ekaccaḥ itthī vā purisaḥ vā aṭṭhaṅga samannāgata
translated: It’s possible that a woman or man who observes the Uposatha complete with its eight factors, at the break-up of the body, after death, may be reborn in companionship with the gods of the Tavatimsa heaven.

analyzed: uposatham upavasitvā kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā tāvatisānam devānam sahabyatam upapajjeyya
translated: and after the breakup of the body, after death, he is reborn among the gods of the Tavatimsa realm.

analyzed: idam khalu paneta visākhe sandhāya bhāsita
translated: It was with reference to this that I said:

analyzed: kapaṇam mānusakam rajjam dibbam sukham upanidhāya
